Authors: Daganzo, CF; Gayah, VV; Gonzales, EJ
Author Full Names: Daganzo, Carlos F.; Gayah, Vikash V.; Gonzales, Eric J.
Article Title: Macroscopic relations of urban traffic variables: Bifurcations, multivaluedness and instability
Author Keywords: Urban mobility; Traffic congestion; Macroscopic fundamental diagram
Abstract: Recent experimental work has shown that the average flow and average density within certain urban networks are related by a unique, reproducible curve known as the Macroscopic Fundamental Diagram (MFD). For networks consisting of a single route this MFD can be predicted analytically: but when the networks consist of multiple overlapping routes experience shows that the flows observed in congestion for a given density are less than those one would predict if the routes were homogeneously congested and did not overlap. These types of networks also tend to jam at densities that are only a fraction of their routes' average jam density. This paper provides an explanation for these phenomena. It shows that, even for perfectly homogeneous networks with spatially uniform travel patterns, symmetric equilibrium patterns with equal flows and densities across all links are unstable if the average network density is sufficiently high. Instead, the stable equilibrium patterns are asymmetric. For this reason the networks jam at lower densities and exhibit lower flows than one would predict if traffic was evenly distributed. Analysis of small idealized networks that can be treated as simple dynamical systems shows that these networks undergo a bifurcation at a network-specific critical density such that for lower densities the MFDs have predictably high flows and are univalued, and for higher densities the order breaks down. Microsimulations show that this bifurcation also manifests itself in large symmetric networks. In this case though, the bifurcation is more pernicious: once the network density exceeds the critical value, the stable state is one of complete gridlock with zero flow. It is therefore important to ensure in real-world applications that a network's density never be allowed to approach this critical value. Fortunately, analysis shows that the bifurcation's critical density increases considerably if some of the drivers choose their routes adaptively in response to traffic conditions. So far, for networks with adaptive drivers, bifurcations have only been observed in simulations, but not (yet) in real life. This could be because real drivers are more adaptive than simulated drivers and/or because the observed real networks were not sufficiently congested. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Optimal congestion taxes in a time allocation model
Author Keywords: Optimal taxation; Congestion; Time-commodity substitution; Derived demand
Keywords Plus: OPTIMAL TAXATION; COMMODITY TAXATION; TRAFFIC CONGESTION; PUBLIC PRODUCTION; CONSUMPTION; TRANSPORT; ECONOMICS; PRIVATE; DESIGN; CHOICE
Abstract: The purpose of this paper is to study optimal congestion taxes in a time-allocation framework. This makes it possible to distinguish taxes on inputs in the production of car trips and taxes on transport as an activity. Moreover, the model allows us to consider the implications of treating transport as a demand, derived from other activities. We extend several well known tax rules from the public finance literature and carefully interpret the implications for the optimal tax treatment of passenger transport services. The main findings of the paper are the following. First, if governments are limited to taxing market inputs into transport trip production, the time-allocation framework: (i) provides an argument for taxing congestion below marginal external cost, (ii) implies a favourable tax treatment for time-saving devices such as GPS, and (iii) provides a previously unnoticed argument for public transport subsidies. Second, if the government has access to perfect road pricing that directly taxes transport as an activity, all previous results disappear. Third, in the absence of perfect road pricing, the activity-specific congestion attracted by employment centres, by shopping centres or by large sports and cultural events should be corrected via higher taxes on market inputs in these activities (e.g., entry tickets, parking fees, etc.). (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Reliable sensor deployment for network traffic surveillance
Author Keywords: Reliable facility location; Sensor deployment; Traffic surveillance; Greedy heuristic; Lagrangian relaxation
Keywords Plus: FACILITY LOCATION; TRIP MATRIX; IDENTIFICATION; OPTIMIZATION; RELIABILITY; MODELS
Abstract: New sensor technologies enable synthesis of disaggregated vehicle information from multiple locations. This paper proposes a reliable facility location model to optimize traffic surveillance benefit from synthesized sensor pairs (e.g., for travel time estimation) in addition to individual sensor flow coverage (e.g., for traffic volume statistics), while considering probabilistic sensor failures. Customized greedy and Lagrangian relaxation algorithms are proposed to solve this problem, and their performance is discussed. Numerical results show that the proposed algorithms solve the problem efficiently. We also discuss managerial insights on how optimal sensor deployment and surveillance benefits vary with surveillance objective and system parameters (such as sensor failure probabilities). (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Hypothetical bias, choice experiments and willingness to pay
Author Keywords: Hypothetical bias; Willingness to pay; Choice experiments; Contingent valuation; Contextual bias; Referencing; Revealed behaviour
Keywords Plus: CONTINGENT VALUATION; CHEAP TALK; REAL; TIME; VALUES
Abstract: There is growing interest in establishing the extent of differences in willingness to pay (WTP) for attributes, such as travel time savings, that are derived from real market settings and hypothetical (to varying degrees) settings. Non-experiment external validity tests involving observation of choice activity in a natural environment, where the individuals do not know they are in an experiment, are rare. In contrast the majority of tests are a test of external validity between hypothetical and actual experiments. Deviation from real market evidence is referred to in the literature broadly as hypothetical bias. The challenge is to identify such bias, and to the extent to which it exists, establishing possible ways to minimise it. This paper reviews the efforts to date to identify and 'calibrate' WTP derived from one or more methods that involve assessment of hypothetical settings, be they (i) contingent valuation methods, (ii) choice experiments involving trading attributes between multiple alternatives, with or without referencing, or (iii) methods involving salient or non-salient incentives linked to actual behaviour. Despite progress in identifying possible contributions to differences in marginal WTP, there is no solid evidence, although plenty of speculation, to explain the differences between all manner of hypothetical experiments and non-experimental evidence. The absence of non-experimental evidence from natural field experiments remains a major barrier to confirmation of under or overestimation. We find, however, that the role of referencing of an experiment relative to a real experience (including evidence from revealed preference (RP) studies), in the design of choice experiments, appears to offer promise in the derivation of estimates of WTP that have a meaningful link to real market activity, closing the gap between RP and SC WTP outputs. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Ibeas, A; Dell'Olio, L; Alonso, B; Sainz, O
Author Full Names: Ibeas, Angel; dell'Olio, Luigi; Alonso, Borja; Sainz, Olivia
Article Title: Optimizing bus stop spacing in urban areas
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Bus stop spacing; Bi-level optimization model; Network design
Keywords Plus: NETWORK DESIGN; PUBLIC TRANSPORT; VEHICLE SIZE; MODEL; OPTIMIZATION; FREQUENCY; SYSTEM
Abstract: This work develops a bi-level optimization model for locating bus stops to minimize the social cost of the overall transport system. The work takes into account possible changes in demand due to different bus stop locations considering congestion on buses, interaction with private traffic, operational variables (fleet, frequency, operator budgets), and the socio-demographic characteristics of each zone in the urban area. Finally, the technique is applied to a real case and a sensitivity analysis is performed to check how the different variables analysed influence the solution provided by the model. Author Full Names: Lownes, Nicholas E.; Machemehl, Randy B.
Article Title: Exact and heuristic methods for public transit circulator design
Author Keywords: Circulator; Transit network design; Feeder; Shuttle; Optimization; Public transportation
Keywords Plus: ROUTE NETWORK DESIGN; GENETIC ALGORITHM; OPTIMIZATION; ASSIGNMENT; SYSTEMS; MODEL
Abstract: This work presents a new mixed integer model for a single-route circulator design problem. An exact method that performs well in practice on medium-sized networks is presented that utilizes 1-trees as lower bounds and a stopping criterion relevant in non-Steiner networks. Proof of the correctness of this stopping criterion is provided. A heuristic method is presented for large networks. Both methods are tested on sample networks along a commuter rail line in Austin, TX in several problem variations and results of these tests presented. The practical and theoretical implications of this work are outlined. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: He, JL; Chang, DF; Mi, WJ; Yan, W
Author Full Names: He, Junliang; Chang, Daofang; Mi, Weijian; Yan, Wei
Article Title: A hybrid parallel genetic algorithm for yard crane scheduling
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Yard crane scheduling; Objective programming; Heuristic rules; Parallel genetic algorithm; Simulation model
Abstract: This paper aims at postulating a novel strategy in terms of yard crane scheduling. In this study, a dynamic scheduling model using objective programming for yard cranes is initially developed based on rolling-horizon approach. To resolve the NP-complete problem regarding the yard crane scheduling, a hybrid algorithm, which employs heuristic rules and parallel genetic algorithm (PGA), is then employed. Then a simulation model is developed for evaluating this approach. Finally, numerical experiments on a specific container terminal yard are used for system illustration. Computational results suggest that the proposed method is able to solve the problem efficiently. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Analysis of Common Disasters of Central Urban District and Emergency Management Countermeasure
Source Title: REGULATORY REGIONAL ECONOMIC CHALLENGE FOR MINING, INVESTMENT, ENVIRONMENT AND WORK SAFETY
Conference Title: International Symposium on Project Management
Conference Sponsor: Xian Univ Architecture & Technol,Wuhan Univ Technol, Jiangsu Campus,Suqian Econom & Business Collage
Author Keywords: central area; common disasters; emergency management; countermeasure
Abstract: Central urban district is the core and source power of the city development. Once the disasters take place in the district, the influences often spread to the country and even all over the world quickly. Based on the analysis of common disasters of central urban district, some suggestions and countermeasures will be given in this paper.

Article Title: The Practice of Aquatic Plants for Purifying Sewage Water to Fuhe River, Baoding City
Source Title: REGULATORY REGIONAL ECONOMIC CHALLENGE FOR MINING, INVESTMENT, ENVIRONMENT AND WORK SAFETY
Conference Title: International Symposium on Project Management
Conference Sponsor: Xian Univ Architecture & Technol,Wuhan Univ Technol, Jiangsu Campus,Suqian Econom & Business Collage
Author Keywords: Water pollution; Eutrophication; Hydrophytes
Abstract: With the economic developing and people's living standards improving, water resources are becoming shorter and shorter, and water pollution has become more and more serious in China. The Fuhe river, which is in Baoding city Hebei province, has become a sewage river with high degree of eutrophication and pollution in need to dredge. We choose and compare 3 plants: Pistia stratiotes, Nymphaea tetragona, Eichhornia crassipes in order to select suitable plants for purifying Baoding Fu River sewage water.

Article Title: Environmental-regulation pricing strategies for green supply chain management
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Extended Production Responsibility; Differential game; Optimal control
Keywords Plus: PRODUCER RESPONSIBILITY; OPTIMAL POLICIES; DESIGN; WASTE; LOGISTICS; MARKETS; TAXES
Abstract: This paper demonstrates that a proper design of environmental-regulation pricing strategies is able to promote Extended Product Responsibility for green supply chain firms in a competitive market. A differential game model comprising Vidale-Wolfe equation has been established in light of sales competition and recycling dynamics as well as regulation related profit function. Analytic solutions of Markovian Nash equilibriums are provided with the necessary condition derived from Hamilton-Jacobi-Bellman equations. We found that governments should opt to gradually raise regulation standards so that rational manufacturers will gradually improve its product recyclability, and, in turn, Extended Product Responsibility will get promoted. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Carriers' pricing behaviors in the United States airline industry
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Airfares; Pricing behavior; Pricing strategy; US airline industry
Abstract: This paper examines the pricing behaviors of United States air carriers in domestic markets. With quarterly observations in 2000 and 2005, we use a heteroskedasticity-adjusted Instrumental Variable technique to investigate the carriers' pricing strategies. The results show differential pricing strategies practiced by United States air carriers. American, United, Continental, and Northwest Airlines have higher airfares than Delta and Southwest Airlines in 2005. In 2000, all the carriers, except Delta have the same relationships with airfares. Furthermore, the findings suggest that the carriers' pricing strategies can vary under the same market condition, indicating that carriers' managerial decisions may influence their airfares. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Choice models based on mixed discrete/continuous PDFs
Author Keywords: Random utility; Choice model; Mixed PDF; Non-compensatory behavior; Decision rules
Keywords Plus: CONTINGENT-VALUATION MODELS; RANDOM UTILITY-MODELS; EXTREME-VALUE MODELS; DISCRETE-CHOICE; CONSUMER CHOICE; SET GENERATION; TRAVEL DEMAND; ALTERNATIVES; THRESHOLDS; PERCEPTION
Abstract: This paper introduces a variant of random utility choice models based on mixed probability density functions, hence the adopted moniker k-Mix models. Mixed pdf's contain components with the usual continuous density function specifications that underlie common choice models (e.g. MNL GEV, MNP), but also contain one or more discrete probability mass points. These mixed pdf's result in models that can be interpreted to reflect different regimes of decision-making. Two exemplars developed in this paper, the 2- and 3-Mix models, are the result of a mixed pdf that combines a continuous pdf plus one or two mass points, respectively. The 2-Mix permits a specific alternative to be in the Tradeoff Condition (the usual situation for alternatives in extant choice models, and the only regime in which compensatory utility is defined and compared) or in the Rejection Condition (in which an alternative has extreme disutility). The 3-Mix model adds the Dominance Condition (in which an alternative has an extremely attractive utility) - interestingly, the inclusion of this condition makes the model capable of simulating a particular form of satisficing decision making. These models are derived, discussed and compared relative to several extant choice models, then applied empirically on both a RP data set (work trip mode choice) and a SP data set (recreation campsite selection). (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: A network equilibrium model with travellers' perception of stochastic travel times
Author Keywords: Stochastic network; Cumulative prospect theory; Perceived travel time distribution; Network equilibrium
Abstract: In this paper, we consider a network whose route travel times are considered to be random variables. In this scenario travellers choose their route, uncertain of the travel time they will experience on any of the available alternative routes. The attractiveness of a given route involves evaluation of both the possible travel time outcomes, and their perceived probability of occurring. We consider a modelling framework where the perceived value and perceived probabilities of travel time outcomes are obtained via nonlinear transformations of the actual travel times and their probabilities. In this context, we present the analysis required to formulate an equilibrium condition analogous to that of User Equilibrium, wherein travellers choose the routes that maximises their perceived value in the face of uncertain travel times. Existence and uniqueness conditions for this equilibrium are established. Cumulative prospect theory (CPT) provides a well supported paradigm for choices made under uncertainty, where each choice alternative presents a discrete probability distribution of a finite number of possible outcomes. Our analysis admits the particular transformations associated with CPT as a special case, and holds for a more general class of transformations and for the case of a continuous distribution of outcomes. Author Full Names: Hensher, David A.; Rose, John M.
Article Title: Simplifying choice through attribute preservation or non-attendance: Implications for willingness to pay
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Attribute preservation; Non-attendance; Information processing; Willingness to pay; Choice experiments
Keywords Plus: STATED CHOICE; MODEL; CANCELLATION; THRESHOLDS; PERCEPTION
Abstract: There is a growing interest in seeking out rules that individuals invoke when processing information in choice experiments. A rule that is attracting attention in stated choice studies is the extent to which respondents attend to or ignore one or more attributes in processing the information on offer. A model specification method is implemented in the context of a stated choice data set where car drivers choose between tolled and non-tolled routes. The evidence into a willingness to pay (WTP) for travel time savings is obtained, and contrasted with the results from the traditional full preservation model. The evidence suggests that the WTP is sufficiently different and higher, on average. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Allowing for intra-respondent variations in coefficients estimated on repeated choice data
Author Keywords: Taste heterogeneity; Panel data; Repeated choice; Stated Choice; Mixed logit
Keywords Plus: TRAVEL-TIME SAVINGS; MIXED LOGIT; MODELS; COMPLEXITY
Abstract: Partly as a result of the increasing reliance on Stated Choice (SC) data, the vast majority of discrete choice modelling applications are now estimated on data containing multiple observations for each respondent. At the same time there has been growing interest in the representation of unexplained heterogeneity in choice data, using random coefficients models such as Mixed Multinomial Logit (MMNL). The presence of multiple observations for each respondent can indeed be a great asset in the identification of such variations in tastes. However, in this paper, we question the validity of the common assumption that tastes vary across respondents but stay constant across repeated choices for the same respondent. We extend the existing framework for the MMNL analysis of panel data by allowing for intra-respondent heterogeneity on top of inter-respondent heterogeneity. An empirical analysis making use of a SC dataset for route choice confirms our hypotheses and shows that superior performance is obtained by our more general model. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved

Authors: Cai, YA; Li, QM; Deng, XP; Wu, WW
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Cai Yuan; Li Qiming; Deng Xiaopeng; Wu Weiwei
Article Title: Study on Dimensions Selection of Safety Climate in Metro Projects
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: metro projects; hazards; safety climate; DEMATEL
Keywords Plus: OCCUPATIONAL ACCIDENTS; PSYCHOLOGICAL CLIMATE; CONSTRUCTION-INDUSTRY; BEHAVIOR; PERFORMANCE; WORK; RISK
Abstract: Background: The metro projects developed rapidly recent years, but because of the characteristics of hazardousness, underground construction, decentralization and mobility in the tunnelling industry, they faced severe status of frequent, impactive safety accidents. More efficient, systemic accident preventing approaches including which focus on organizational factors have to be crying for in China. Objective: To discover the organizational reason for the hazards on construction site and to analyze the relationship between safety climates and safety results. Methods: A detailed literature review is firstly conducted, summarizing and analyzing the researches that struggled to find theoretical and empirical evidence to demonstrate actual links between safety climate and safety results such as accident rate, safety behavior, safety performance, perceived safety risks and so on. Then, on the basis of the previous researches and the characteristics of metro projects, Decision Making Trial and Evaluation Laboratory (DEMATEL) is used to select the main factors of safety climate on construction sites of metro projects. Results: The significant influence of safety climate on prediction of accident rate is demonstrated and the relationship between safety climate and safety behavior, safety performance and perceived safety risks also has been discovered. Then the leading factors of safety climate which could predict the safety results is analyzed for predict the safety results. Conclusions: The result factors selected by DEMATEL are shown to be excellent real-time signals to predict the site safety results of the metro projects.

Article Title: Comparative Study on Technology Standardization of Construction Engineering between China and Japan
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: technical regulation; technical standard; comparative study
Abstract: It is imperative for system of Chinese construction standards to adapt to international rules. Based on research on system of construction technical regulation-technical standards, the relationship between Technical standards and technical regulations, construction market access in Japan, through carrying out Comparative analysis, the article puts forward countermeasures and proposals, with combining present situation in China and advanced experience in Japan. It is necessary to be modified and improved for current standardization legal system in China,and to adapt to the external environment for development of economic globalization and trade liberalization. A specific system should be formed as soon as possible and we should establish a group of the qualified quality certification bodies and technical approval institutions.

Author Full Names: He, S. K.; Yao, H. X.
Article Title: Buy-Back Policy Before the Concessionary Period Due in BOT Based on Real Option
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: BOT; buying-back decision flexibility; consumer surplus; ex-change options
Abstract: Because of the long time of public infrastructure of BOT models' implementation, it is possible that the project companies are faced with serious difficulties in the concession period, or the government may consider that the original purchase and the service charges are too high, as a result, the interests of consumers are occupied. To give full play to the return on investment in the project and the public's interest, the government has to consider buy-backing the projects ahead of concession period. In order to determine reasonably the timing of the project repurchase, using real option pricing theory, when BOT project in the charges for services and consumer surplus is uncertainty, buying-back decision flexibility is used an ex-changed option. The paper present the optimal lower-trigger of buy-back project option, buying-back decisions' rules. The paper also discussed the effect of important parameters on the optimal triggers buying-back decisions' rules. Finally, numerical calibration of the buying-back decisions' rules is given in the paper, and show that this buying-back decisions' rules is operatical in application.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Jin Zhanyong; Sun Jinying; Liu Changbin; Zhang Yalin
Article Title: Economic Incentive Mechanism Design for Green Buildings based on Analysis of Externalities
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Green buildings; Economic incentive; Mechanism design
Abstract: To develop green buildings is the inevitable choice for sustainable development. But, the resource allocation of green buildings is failed due to positive externality and intergenerational externality, which influences green buildings' development seriously. Motivating green buildings developers which are the most positive part in response to the national requirement is the best way to promote the development of green buildings. It established a dynamic game model with perfect information between central government and real estate developers by the principles and methods of economics. A conclusion can be drawn that the key factor which influenced central government to implement economic incentive policies or not is incentive effect. Central government would not implement economic incentive policies when incentive degree exceeded its bearing capacity. Real estate developers would not always develop green buildings although central government implemented economic incentive policies. In order to develop green buildings products and establish and perfect green buildings markets, central government should adopt supply-oriented and carrot with rod economic incentive mechanism as well as corresponding economic incentive policies. It can motivate the real estate developers who have great passion on green buildings and are in good financial condition, and urgently need supports.

Article Title: Study on China's Real Estate Industry Development
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: real estate industry; grey model; forecasting; price
Abstract: In recent years, Real Estate Industry in China developed and is developing very quickly. real estate industry is indispensable for the urban construction, the human residential environment and strengthen the economic construction. Average Selling Price, Residential Building sold, Buildings under Construction and Buildings Complete all increased very quickly. But at the same there are some problems emerge. Central government put many Macro policies altogether in recent years on the real estate industry, including land, credit, tax, second-hand house and low-price housing policies. In the same period, although the ratio of price's rise dropped a little, but it is still on the high level. The continuous rise of house price will bring two macro risk at least. The paper applied Grey Model and forecast the developing tendency in Chinese Real Estate Industry. And bring forward high price problem and housing structure will be the most important problem in the Real Estate industry developing process in the next few years.

Article Title: Study on the Incentive Policies on Promoting the Utilization of Renewable Energy in Buildings Based on Ecology
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Ecology; Incentive policies; Utilization of renewable energy in buildings
Abstract: Utilization of renewable energy in buildings is a domain which the market mechanism is partly failure. It is necessary for government to formulate incentive policies to promote the work. The establishment of the policies has relationships with the actions and the mutual relations of the participators in this work. Using the theory of ecology, the paper establishes the ecosystem of renewable energy utilization in buildings, studies the development and community succession of regional industrial ecosystem (RIES) and their influence on policy establishment, analysis keystone-species of RIES in different development phase and its influence on policy establishment. The article analyses the actions of different kind of participator using the idea of ecological niche, and the influence on policy establishment. Basing on above studies, the article points out that the utilization of renewable energy in buildings must proceed in an orderly and gradual way and the incentive policies must be systematic. In different phase of the renewable energy utilization in buildings, there are some key ecology-species. The incentive policies should take the action and function of the key ecology-species into consideration.

Article Title: A Study on Economic Bearing Capacity in War
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT ICPEM 2009, VOL 9: SOCIAL SCIENCE METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: war; the economic bearing capacity
Abstract: This paper Introduces the critical theory in the study of the economic bearing capacity It confines the critical value of every economic variable when the nation's economic safety state transforms its critical points In addition to that, it makes use of the decomposition method in mechanics theories to analyze the economic bearing capacity to the war expenditure The study puts forward the theory of endogenesis, that is, the economic bearing capacity of war is determined by the running state of the country's economy Given the evaluation model of the economic bearing capacity on the three sub-systems of domestic economy, international economy and defense economy, the theory defines the value of the hell by making use of the established warning line of the country's economic safety In addition, the research also proposes such an innovative concept that national interests consists of the interests of national security, economy and culture, and the economic bearing capacity is decided by the bearing capacity of the critical points

Authors: Liu, J; Zheng, L; Zhang, X
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Liu, J.; Zheng, L.; Zhang, X.
Article Title: Analysis on Practicing Credit Growth Environment of Registered Supervision Engineers
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Registered supervision engineers (RSEs); Practicing credit; Practicing credit growth environment (PCGE)
Abstract: The credit growth environment is the basis for credit culture and development. The practicing credit growth environment (PCGE) of registered supervision engineers (RSEs) is mainly composed of legal environment, information environment and incentive environment with a direct and great effect on the RSEs' practicing credit. The effect of legal environment, information environment and incentive environment on the growth of practicing credit is analyzed in this paper. Then the construction status quo of the PCGE is described and some problems are pointed out. On the basis of these work, some suggestions were proposed: a national level unified credit standard should be erected to accelerate credit information sharing of RSEs; bid evaluation method should be improved and professional liability insurance should be popularized to strengthen the market discipline; the social supervision forces should be enhanced to improve the credit guarantee mechanism.

Article Title: Treasury Bills for Rectifying Financial Order Issued by Jiangxi Provincial Government
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: Treasury Bills for Rectifying Financial Order; financial crisis; bond issue
Abstract: Treasury Bills for Rectifying Financial Order (Treasury Bills for short) is a local bonds issued by Jiangxi provincial government in the early founding days of the Kuomintang government for the purpose of easing the unprecedented financial crisis in this province. By taking such measures as issuing Treasury Bills, cleaning up the Jiangxi local bank debts, withdrawing old Jiangxi banknotes, bonds issued by Jiangxi government in 1921, local bonds issued by Jiangxi government in 1935 and allocating sufficient capital to Yumin Bank, the provincial government finally managed alleviate the most serious financial crisis in Jiangxi's modern times. The issue of Treasury Bills has provided a good reference and inspiration for today's local bond issuing.

Article Title: Inequality and Institutions: a Survey
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT ICPEM 2009, VOL 9: SOCIAL SCIENCE METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: inequality; institutions; endogenous evolution
Abstract: Literature on inequality and institutions is examined, focusing on three perspectives First, from inequality to institutions, inequality encourages institutional subversions in two different ways Second, from institutions to inequality, both governmental partisanship and labor market institutions are considered to be the primary institutions affecting inequality Thirdly, there are more and more models considering inequality and institutions endogenously recently Endogenous evolution of inequality and institutions in unified models needs further research

Authors: Mihalache, A; Vintila, C; Cornescu, A
Book Editors: Perlovsky, L; Dionysiou, DD; Zadeh, LA; Kostic, MM; GonzalezConcepcion, C; Jaberg, H
Author Full Names: Mihalache, Andrei; Vintila, Cornel; Cornescu, Adela
Article Title: A New Model Approach for Business Applications in Enterprise 2.0 Environment
Source Title: AEBD '09: PROCEEDINGS OF THE WORLD MULTICONFERENCE ON APPLIED ECONOMICS, BUSINESS AND DEVELOPMENT
Book Series Title: Recent Advances in Computer Engineering
Conference Title: World Multiconference on Applied Economics, Business and Development (AEBD '09)
Author Keywords: business process reengineering; software reverse engineering; change management; the service-oriented architecture
Abstract: For any enterprise, the strategy and goals are vital, but the execution leads to concrete results. The main cause of the gap between the strategic objectives and processes execution is determined by the insufficient encouragement of the collaboration and the lack of adaptability of business applications which assist to the continuous evolution of business conditions. In order to stay competitive on the market, all the activities must have a business application support that provides the necessary data in real time, and monitors the execution of each task. For many software products it is difficult to adapt to the business context. In order to improve the performance of the enterprise it is crucial to have a whole visibility over the impact of actions, the contribution of each process to strategic objectives. This paper aims to reveal the importance of reverse engineering software in order to deduce the specific behavior and to target, analyze, extract and modify all the operations of the present informatics systems and direct engineering using a process and service-oriented architecture aligned with the strategic level and environment reality, usually for interoperability purposes, knowledge exchange and improvement of the collaboration between employees.

Authors: Minke, A; Ambrosi, K; Hahne, F
Book Editors: Athanasiadis, IN; Mitkas, PA; Rizzoli, AE; Gomez, JM
Author Full Names: Minke, Anneke; Ambrosi, Klaus; Hahne, Felix
Article Title: Approach for Dynamic Problems in Clustering
Book Series Title: Environmental Science and Engineering
Conference Title: 4th International ICSC Symposium on Information Technologies in Environmental Engineering
Conference Sponsor: ICSC
Author Keywords: Clustering; Fuzzy Clustering; Dynamic Data Analysis
Abstract: In cluster analysis, a variety of methods has been developed for different areas of application (e.g. economic, ecology, medicine, psychology), some of which were implemented in data evaluation software packages (e.g. SPSS(x), SAS). In many scenarios, particularly economic and ecological ones, special methods are required in order to analyze the development of clusters over time. While there are such methodical extensions for factor analysis and multidimensional scaling, hardly any dynamic approaches exist in the field of cluster analysis. In this paper, special attention will be paid to dynamic fuzzy clustering problems. Known approaches will be reviewed critically concerning their applicability in dynamic problems, and a new fuzzy clustering approach will be introduced which can be applied to dynamic problems.

Article Title: Analysis of Credit-based Project Conflict Management
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Credit; Conflict transfer; Conflict handling; project management mode
Abstract: With the rapid development of economy in China, the engineering projects have been more sweeping and complex In the mean while, cross-border projects play more and more important roles. But with that prosperity, a mass of conflict phenomena appear, which seriously affect projects' goals. Overseas' research shows that credit mechanism which applied in conflict management can benefit project course. Using credit mechanism, this article analyzes the character and root which lead to the conflicts between multiple partners. On the basis of credit relationship, credit behaviors and credit system, a project conflict transfer and handling mode is established to solve these problems in project such as information transfer, personnel collaboration, variation claims, resources arrangement, management processes and so on. The conflict transfer and handling mode and additional management process can improve project conflict handling efficiency and promote the realization of the project goals.

Book Editors: Zhang, MH; Yu, Y
Article Title: The Transformation and Innovation of the Food Safety Supervision in New China
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: China food safety; system transformation; system innovation; path dependence
Abstract: The food safety supervision system has experienced several vicissitudes after the founding of the PRC. The system transformation is the consequence that the path dependence comes into play. The further evolution and innovation of the system of the food safety supervision in China is still affected by the dependence of the path. This thesis is based on the theory of path dependence and related to the fact of China. On the basis of the deeply analysis of the transformation and innovation of the history of the food safety supervision, the thesis puts forward proposals for future changes: firstly, the food safety is not only a domestic issue but also a worldwide problem. The system construction should base itself upon the domestic and also need look around the world; secondly, execution of the system is an interactive process, it depends on the coordination of many factors; thirdly, system is a dynamic evolution. With the transformation of the environment, it needs timely revising.

Article Title: Development of a decision support system for the operation of thermal power plants in Western Macedonia

Conference Sponsor: ICSC
Abstract: The paper describes the DSS jointly developed by ETL/UoWM, EREL/NCSRD and PPC's Department of Environment / Production. It is of an innovative environmental management system which aims to : (i) continuously monitor and predict air quality in the operating region of the power plants and (ii) support the decisions which are relative to the dispatching strategies of the power plants, in order to limit as far as possible the exceedance of the permissible levels of atmospheric pollution.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Establishing Coordination System for Construction Projects by Simulating The Circulatory System
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: circulatory system; homeostasis; coordination system; coordination needs and supply; construction projects
Abstract: Coordination has been regarded as a critical factor of successful projects. Because construction projects are highly fragmented with many participants involved at different construction stages, coordination is more complicated. However, coordination is usually not well planned and executed to manage the interfaces so the project performance is not as expected. This paper establishes the coordination systems for construction projects by simulating circulatory system because the physiological function of the human body is natural and effective. Three mechanisms of the circulatory system were drawn and applied on project coordination. (1) Normal operation. Blood is pumped by the heart, transported to all body organs through arteries, and then returns to the heart through veins. In the construction, the contractor (heart) supplies information (nutrients) to project parties (organs) by coordination (blood flow) methods (arteries and veins). Coordination needs is derived from project uncertainty and equivocality (U&E), and supply is offered by different methods engineers use to coordinate. Supply matching needs results in better project performance. (2) Monitoring system. Sensory receptors are the key to meet the needs for human body. Baroreceptors and Chemoreceptors can sense blood pressure, blood O-2, CO2 and pH, and then transmit stimulus to the central nervous system. A monitoring system in the contractor is needed in which a few managers or engineers are assigned as receptors to measure the appropriateness of coordination with the owner, subcontractors and internal members. (3) Regulation mechanism. For unexpected change, blood flow is mainly regulated by nervous and hormonal system after the change is sensed. When the construction project has a change or accident, coordination needs change as well. To meet coordination needs, supply should be adjusted such as more meetings and informal discussion. The three mechanisms can be transferred into practical operation procedures which are implemented at planning and execution stages to help contractors coordinate effectively.

Article Title: Public Health in the Time of Crisis: A Global Perspective

Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)

Author Keywords: public health; financial crisis; global
Abstract: Countries at all levels of economic development are concerned about the impact of the financial crisis on health In the recession, diminishing health expenditure from states, reduction in the supply of health resources expose citizens at the risk of worsening health Meanwhile, increasing demand of public health care due to financially Incapable accessing to private health care, calls for an improved public care system with strategies both in the short-term and in the long-term by states

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Research on the Specification of Automated Valuation Models for Residential Properties in China
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Automated valuation model (AVM); Comparable sales method; Computer aided mass appraisal (CAMA); Direct market method; Residential properties
Abstract: Recently the Chinese government has been preparing in many aspects for the levy of property tax, among which the development of the computer aided mass appraisal (CAMA) system is an important technical foundation. The computer aided mass appraisal (CAMA) system is an important tool in property assessment and taxation, and its reliability and accuracy highly depends on the proper specification of the automated valuation model (AVM) employed in the system. Based on the particularities of residential properties in urban China and the current data conditions in most Chinese cities, this paper improves the conventional direct market method suggested in literatures by introducing and combining the comparable sales method, and develops two improved direct market methods, namely, the direct market-comparable sales method and the hybrid method. The empirical results of the AV/MV ratio test studies indicate that these two improved methods can significantly increase the appraisal accuracy and better satisfy the requirements in the standards. So these methods are suggested for the CAMA system in China.

Article Title: New Trend on Provision of Regional Public Goods: Organizational Cooperation
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT ICPEM 2009, VOL 9: SOCIAL SCIENCE METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: organizational cooperation; public goods; local governments; cooperation benefit; cooperation cost
Abstract: The emergence and rise of organizational cooperation generates new development to the traditional provision pattern of public goods It is especially beneficial to regional local governments, for they can select adjacent governments, local businesses, and third party to cooperate with in order to provide regional public goods and services more effectively Share of the expected benefits from cooperation and comparison of the cooperation cost make it possible to select cooperation. However, in order to further reduce the cooperation cost, increase cooperation proceeds, and to maintain stable cooperation relationship, it is necessary to establish and improve the cooperative mechanism and solve possible problems which may be encountered in future operation As a new delivery pattern for public goods, organizational cooperation has a broad prospect to research and develop

Book Editors: You, XO; Zhang, LF

Article Title: Priority Order Selection of Public Goods Supply in Beijing Rural Areas: Based on the View Point of Demand
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT ICPEM 2009, VOL 9: SOCIAL SCIENCE METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: rural public goods; demand; priority order
Abstract: The building of the new socialist countryside is a major historic task in the process of modernization in China, and increasing the supply of public goods in rural areas is a significant measure for the construction of new socialist countryside. From the perspective of the current level of development of the rural economy, the government-led public goods supply is necessary in rural areas. For this reason, this paper will re-examine the supplying range of rural public goods with a general definition. From the perspective of demand of the public goods, the authors conducted a questionnaire survey to rural residents in Beijing and draw a conclusion that the priority order of providing public goods is. education, scientific research Input and conversion, investment in rural infrastructure construction and Improve the rural social security system and health care systems

Article Title: Explaining Intercity Variations in Urban Size: An Empirical Study of Chinese Cities
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Urban spatial size; Intercity variations; Mono-centric model; Panel data analysis; China
Abstract: The theoretic framework of new urban economics, mono-centric urban model, suggests that urban size is determined by an orderly market process which allocates land between urban and agricultural use. Several factors, including population growth, personal income, transportation costs and agricultural land value, are assumed to explain most of urban growth over time and urban size variations across cities. This paper focuses empirically on the variations of urban sizes among Chinese cities by employing the classic mono-centric model in urban economics. The econometric results suggest that fundamental economics factors, identified by the mono-centric theory, are of primary importance explaining the variation of urban spatial sizes. The empirical study contains data of more than 200 major cities in China and over 10 years. In cross-sectional analysis, population, transportation costs, personal income and agricultural land price determine nearly 90% of variations. In panel data analysis, population growth is the most influential factor.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Building the Integrated Sorting and Coding System For Construction Project in China
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Construction project; The sorting and coding system; The implementation model
Abstract: Timing target, quality target and cost target are most important three targets in the target system of construction project management. It is very necessary to build the sorting and coding system of construction project, in which, schedule management information, quality management information and cost management information can be integrated to carry out integrated management model of construction project objective. In China, quality management and cost management must comply with the various codes and standards, for example Unified standard for constructional quality acceptance of building engineering and Code of valuation with bill quantity of construction works, which are promulgated by Ministry of Construction (MOC) and General Administration of Quality Supervision, Inspection and Quarantine (AQSIQ), and there is a sophisticated set of practices in the field of schedule management. There is a set of the sorting and coding system each other in these codes, standards and practices, and there is not consistent between them. Therefore, understanding the differences, which exist in the different sorting and coding system, is crucial for building the integrated sorting and coding system of construction project. This study analyzes the differences and finds the internal accord in the different sorting system by comparison method. Based on these analysis, some principle of establishing the integrate sorting and coding system of construction project and the implementation model are bring out. The findings can assist some software companies and employers developing a kind of integrated project management information system and enhance the performance of entire construction project management.

Book Editors: Athanasiadis, IN; Mitkas, PA; Rizzoli, AE; Gomez, JM
Article Title: Enterprise systems applications development plans to build and develop robust and environmentally sensitive green logistics systems management software
Book Series Title: Environmental Science and Engineering
Conference Title: 4th International ICSC Symposium on Information Technologies in Environmental Engineering
Conference Sponsor: ICSC
Author Keywords: Green Logistics; Quality Management; Environment Management; SCM; ERP; Robustness; Ecoinformatics
Abstract: Within the concept of enterprise-wide development of environmentally sensitive systems' application modules to fully integrate all-in-one green logistics services principles have received much attention and consideration from practitioners, academia, and from the industry, for about more than a decade. However, by taking into the consideration of the multidisciplinary nature of the issue, large scale effective collaborative framework is needed to be developed. Therefore, utilization of UML diagrams, class definitions, defining class relationships, fields, tables, views, etc. so on play crucial roles in the design phases of the enterprise system. Thus, this article largely deals with the major logistics work processes and their interactions within the consideration of environmental engineering issues on business operations to address step-by-step process control mechanisms to provide necessary input to build robust-design and better implementation of the needed IT software backbone.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Achieving Carbon Neutral Construction: A Review of Viable Techniques
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Carbon neutral; Construction; Reduction; Recycling; Offsetting
Abstract: Construction project is one of the major human activities contributing to greenhouse gas emissions which lead to global warming. Methods for achieving carbon neutral typically include reducing, recycling and offsetting. Reduction techniques consist of using green building technology, energy efficient materials, renewable energy and passive design such as natural ventilation. Recycling techniques involve using recycled materials and recycling waste. Offsetting techniques refer to investing in carbon capturing methods such as planting trees and account for carbon emissions that cannot be eliminated through other means. While significant past research has explored a particular or some techniques to lower the carbon footprint of human activities, unavailable is a comprehensive review of techniques to reduce greenhouse gas emission in construction industry. This paper reviewed and analysed viable reducing, recycling and offsetting techniques that can be adopted by the responsible construction industry stakeholders striking for carbon neutral construction.

Authors: Zhang, MX; Zhang, DL; Gao, QC
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Zhang, Ming Xuan; Zhang, Dong Lei; Gao, Quan Chen
Article Title: Research on Safety Management Maturity Model of Construction Company
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Construction company; Safety management; Maturity model; Grey relational analysis; Fuzzy number
Abstract: The safety management deficiencies of construction company are one of the major factors that caused construction safety accidents. In order to study how to assess the safety management state of the construction company, improve the safety administration level of the China's construction company continuously, grey correlation evaluation model of construction company safety management maturity and evaluation criteria based on the professional standards in China, Standard of the Work Safety Assessment For Construction Company (JGJ/T77-2003), are put forward. Three-level evaluation system of construction company safety management, hierarchy and evaluation standard of safety management maturity model are established. Taking into account the uncertainty of evaluation indexes and the subjectivity of assessment personnel, the paper applied triangular fuzzy numbers to represent weights and assessment results of the evaluation index, used centre coordinates to calculate fuzzy weights of the assessment index. The safety management maturity evaluation results and improvement requirement of construction company can be achieved by means of this approach. An illustrative example is made to show the process and evaluation effect of this method.

Book Editors: Zhang, MH; Yu, Y
Article Title: Can Commodity be an Eligible Asset Class for Social Security Fund
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: asset allocation; social security fund; commodity; Sharpe ratio
Abstract: Based on sample data ranging from 1996 to 2008, this paper investigates the feasibility and profitability of including commodity as an asset class for social security fund. The result shows that the proxy of commodity price, Reuters CRB CCI, offers a higher Sharpe ratio compared with Standard & Poor 500. In addition, given the volatility of Shanghai Stock Exchange Composite Index and the latest returns data of China 5-year Treasure Bills, Reuters CRB CCI and its sub-indexes even beat them to be a better choice for China Social Security Fund. As it not only provides a handful profit outnumber inflation, but also enables the China citizens to profit from the double-digit growth of the economy.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Sustainable Housing Implementation through Mutual Benefits to Stakeholders-A decision making approach
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: sustainability; housing; stakeholder; benefits; decision-making
Abstract: Improved public awareness and strong sentiments towards environmental issues will continue to create increasing demand for sustainable housing (SH) in the coming years. Despite this potential, the up-take rate of sustainable housing in new build and through home renovation is not as high as expected within the housing industry. This is in contrast to the influx of emerging building technologies, new materials and innovative designs seen in exemplar homes built worldwide. How we should use the increasing awareness of SH and emerging technologies as an impetus to change the un-sustainable designs and practices of the building industry is high on the agenda of the government and majority of the stakeholders involved. This warrants the study of multifaceted strategies that meet the needs of multiple stakeholders and integrated seamlessly into housing development processes. Specifically, the different perceptions, roles and incentives of stakeholders, who inevitably need to ensure their benefits and commercial returns, should be highlighted and acted upon. This paper discusses the preliminary findings of a research project that aims to promote SH implementation by identifying and materializing the mutual benefits among key stakeholders. The aim is to be achieved through questionnaire surveys, structural equation modelling, interviews and case studies with seven major stakeholders within the Australian housing industry. This research identifies the influence and relationship of relevant factors, investigates preferences, similarities and differences between stakeholders on perceived benefits and in turn explores the mutual-benefit strategy package that facilitates decision making towards sustainable housing development.

Article Title: Random and fuzzy utility models for road route choice
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Route choice; Assignment; Freight model; Fuzzy model
Abstract: The objective of this work is the specification, calibration and validation of a route choice model distinguishing the phases of set perception and route choice among the alternatives belonging to the chosen set. Route generation is performed with a selective multi-criteria approach; route choice is performed using random and fuzzy utility models. As regards the fuzzy utility models, a new specification of a fuzzy model is introduced. Random and fuzzy utility models are compared and applied on a test road network and were specified and calibrated for national road freight transport on a real Italy-wide network. Authors: Hensher, DA; Greene, WH; Li, Z
Author Full Names: Hensher, David A.; Greene, William H.; Li, Zheng
Article Title: Embedding risk attitude and decision weights in non-linear logit to accommodate time variability in the value of expected travel time savings
Author Keywords: Expected utility theory; Probability weighting; Risk attitude; Non-linear logit; Trip time variability; Valuation of expected travel time savings
Keywords Plus: WILLINGNESS-TO-PAY; PROSPECT-THEORY; UTILITY; MODEL; PROBABILITY; UNCERTAINTY; RELIABILITY; BEHAVIOR; CHOICE
Abstract: In recent years we have seen important extensions of logit models in behavioural research such as incorporation of preference and scale heterogeneity, attribute processing heuristics, and estimation of willingness to pay (WTP) in WTP space. With rare exception, however, a non-linear treatment of the parameter set to allow for behavioural reality, such as embedded risk attitude and perceptual conditioning of occurrence probabilities attached to specific attributes, is absent. This is especially relevant to the recent focus in travel behaviour research on identifying the willingness to pay for reduced travel time variability, which is the source of estimates of the value of trip reliability that has been shown to take on an increasingly important role in project appraisal. This paper incorporates, in a generalised non-linear (in parameters) logit model, alternative functional forms for perceptual conditioning (known as probability weighting) and risk attitude in the utility function to account for travel time variability, and then derives an empirical estimate of the willingness to pay for trip time variability-embedded travel time savings as an alternative to separate estimates of time savings and trip time reliability. We illustrate the richness of the approach using a stated choice data set for commuter choice between unlabelled attribute packages. Statistically significant risk attitude parameters and parameters underlying decision weights are estimated for multinomial logit and mixed multinomial logit models, along with values of expected travel time savings. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Chou, JS; Kim, C; Kuo, YC; Ou, NC
Author Full Names: Chou, Jui-Sheng; Kim, Changwan; Kuo, Yao-Chen; Ou, Nai-Chi
Article Title: Deploying effective service strategy in the operations stage of high-speed rail
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Transportation service management; Performance measurement; Facilities management; Service quality; Passenger satisfaction index; Structural equation analysis
Keywords Plus: CUSTOMER SATISFACTION INDEX; IMPORTANCE-PERFORMANCE ANALYSIS; STRUCTURAL EQUATION MODEL; PERCEIVED VALUE; EFFECTIVE CRM; QUALITY; PASSENGERS; PERCEPTIONS; FUTURE; EXPECTATIONS
Abstract: This paper utilizes a confirmatory passenger continuance behavior model to appraise highspeed rail service quality and performance. Surveys are administered for Taiwan High-Speed Rail (THSR) and Korea Train express (KTX) corporations to gain an understanding of passengers' perceptions of the operational performance using a proposed satisfaction index. A modified importance-performance analysis is employed to enable elaboration of strategic service management decisions. The empirical study concludes that level of access to THSR station and personal space on KTX train are the top-priority quality indicators that need to be addressed to improve customer satisfaction and corporate profits. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: First-best marginal cost toll for a traffic network with stochastic demand
Author Keywords: First-best toll; Marginal cost pricing; Stochastic network; Demand uncertainty
Keywords Plus: USER EQUILIBRIUM; ROAD NETWORK; ASSIGNMENT; TRAVEL; RELIABILITY; OPTIMUM; UNCERTAINTY; MODELS
Abstract: First-best marginal cost pricing (MCP) in traffic networks has been extensively studied with the assumption of deterministic travel demand. However, this assumption may not be realistic as a transportation network is exposed to various uncertainties. This paper investigates MCP in a traffic network under stochastic travel demand. Cases of both fixed and elastic demand are considered. In the fixed demand case, travel demand is represented as a random variable, whereas in the elastic demand case, a pre-specified random variable is introduced into the demand function. The paper also considers a set of assumptions of traveler behavior. In the first case, it is assumed that the traveler considers only the mean travel time in the route choice decision (risk-neutral behavior), and in the second, both the mean and the variance of travel time are introduced into the route choice model (risk-averse behavior). A closed-form formulation of the true marginal cost toll for the stochastic network (SN-MCP) is derived from the variational inequality conditions of the system optimum and user equilibrium assignments. The key finding is that the calculation of the SN-MCP model cannot be made by simply substituting related terms in the original MCP model by their expected values. The paper provides a general function of SN-MCP and derives the closed-form SN-MCP formulation for specific cases with lognormal and normal stochastic travel demand. Four numerical examples are explored to compare network performance under the SN-MCP and other toll regimes. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Patterson, Z; Ewing, GO; Haider, M
Author Full Names: Patterson, Zachary; Ewing, Gordon O.; Haider, Murtaza
Article Title: How different is carrier choice for third party logistics companies?
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Mode choice modeling; Third party logistics companies; Freight modeling
Abstract: The purpose of this paper is to test whether third party logistics companies (3PLs) are different from other end-shippers with respect to how they choose their carriers. The results of carrier choice models developed in this paper suggest that 3PLs are more biased against intermodal shipping than other end-shippers. The principal conclusions are as follows: mode and carrier choice modeling needs to take into consideration differences between 3PLs and other end-shippers; and with the increasing role of 3PLs in choosing carriers, their stronger bias against intermodal shipping will present further challenges to increasing freight rail mode share. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Zhu, ZG; Chu, F; Sun, LY
Author Full Names: Zhu, Zhanguo; Chu, Feng; Sun, Linyan
Article Title: The capacitated plant location problem with customers and suppliers matching
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Plant location; Lagrangian relaxation; Matching; Integer linear programming
Keywords Plus: FACILITY LOCATION; ROUTING PROBLEM; SINGLE-SOURCE; LOWER BOUNDS; TABU SEARCH; ALGORITHM; HEURISTICS; 2-ECHELON; MODELS; SYSTEM
Abstract: This paper introduces a new problem called the capacitated plant location problem with customer and supplier matching (CLCSM). The product distribution from plants to customers and the material supply from suppliers to plants are considered together. We merge a distribution trip and a supply trip into one triangular trip for saving allocation cost. Vehicles from plants visit a customer and a supplier for each trip. We provide a heuristic solution procedure based on Lagrangian relaxation. Computational results indicate that the proposed heuristic solution procedure is shown to be efficient yielding optimal or near-optimal solutions for randomly generated instances. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

The construction and improvement of the ecological compensation mechanism is an important strategic choice to scientific development concept and implementation of the human and nature. Conference Title: International Symposium on Project Management

Author Keywords: low-permeable rock; porosity characteristics; permeable characteristics; permeability
Abstract: Through press mercury test, scanning electron microcopy observation and hydraulic servo controller test, the porosity and permeable characteristics of low permeable rock were analyzed, the result indicates that the initial and the maximum permeability of the rocks of most layers in the area is all low, which belong to low permeable aquifer. The conclusion is identical to the site pump test results.

Article Title: The marginal social cost of headway for a scheduled service
Author Keywords: Value of travel time; Headway; Frequency; Public transport
Abstract: This brief paper derives the marginal social cost of headway for a scheduled service, i.e. the cost for users of marginal increases to the time interval between departures. In brief we may call it the value of headway in analogy with the value of travel time and the value of reliability. Users have waiting time costs as well as schedule delay costs measured relative to their desired time of arrival at the destination. They may either arrive at the station to choose just the next departure or they may plan for a specific departure in which case they incur also a planning cost. Then planning for a specific departure is costly but becomes more attractive at longer headways. Simple expressions for the user cost result. In particular, the marginal cost of headway is large at short headways and smaller at long headways. The difference in marginal costs is the value of time multiplied by half the headway. Authors: Hu, SR; Peeta, S; Chu, CH
Author Full Names: Hu, Shou-Ren; Peeta, Srinivas; Chu, Chun-Hsiao
Article Title: Identification of vehicle sensor locations for link-based network traffic applications
Author Keywords: Network sensor location problem; Basis link; Link-based applications
Keywords Plus: ORIGIN-DESTINATION MATRICES; COUNTING LOCATION; OBSERVABILITY PROBLEM; ALGORITHMS; MODELS
Abstract: Information on link flows in a vehicular traffic network is critical for developing long-term planning and/or short-term operational management strategies. In the literature, most studies to develop such strategies typically assume the availability of measured link traffic information on all network links, either through manual survey or advanced traffic sensor technologies. In practical applications, the assumption of installed sensors on all links is generally unrealistic due to budgetary constraints. It motivates the need to estimate flows on all links of a traffic network based on the measurement of link flows on a subset of links with suitably equipped sensors. This study, addressed from a budgetary planning perspective, seeks to identify the smallest subset of links in a network on which to locate sensors that enables the accurate estimation of traffic flows on all links of the network under steady-state conditions. Here, steady-state implies that the path flows are static. A basis link method is proposed to determine the locations of vehicle sensors, by using the link-path incidence matrix to express the network structure and then identifying its basis in a matrix algebra context. The theoretical background and mathematical properties of the proposed method are elaborated. The approach is useful for deploying long-term planning and link-based applications in traffic networks. (c) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: 被撤回的出版物: The vehicle routing problem with uncertain demand at nodes (Retracted article. See vol. 47, pg. 571, 2011)
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Sweeping algorithm; Fuzzy arithmetic rule; Vehicle routing problem; Vehicle coordinated strategy
Abstract: The vehicle routing problem with uncertain demand at nodes is considered. The approximate reasoning algorithm is developed to determine the preference strength to send the vehicle to next node, and the improved sweeping algorithm with vehicle coordinated strategy is originally proposed to determine a set of vehicle routes that minimizes costs. Finally the computational results are presented to show the high effectiveness and performance of the solution approaches. Crown Copyright (C) 2008 Published by Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.
