Article Title: A model of household time allocation taking into consideration of hiring domestic helpers
Author Keywords: Household interactions; Domestic helpers; Models of time allocation; Activity-travel behavior
Keywords Plus: OUT-OF-HOME; ACTIVITY PARTICIPATION; TRAVEL INTERACTIONS; IN-HOME; CHOICE; VALUES
Abstract: Household maintenance such as childcare not only induces activities and travel but also impose time constraints on individuals' participation in other activities and travel. Instead of sharing household responsibilities, households may hire domestic helpers for household maintenance. Alternatively, they may get helps from members of the extended family such as parents of household heads. This paper develops a model to analyze households' trade-offs between hiring domestic helpers for household maintenance and taking these responsibilities by household members. We will apply household economic theories to develop a time allocation model incorporating interactions among household members. We assume that households trade off the money they are willing to spend for hiring helpers with the time they may need to spend for household maintenance activities to maximize utilities, subject to time constraints. The model may be used to analyze the impacts of domestic helpers on household members' time allocation to subsistence, maintenance and recreation activities. It may also be applied to analyze the impacts of government policies regarding the minimum salary of domestic helpers and the change of household members' wage rates on households' decision to hire helpers. The paper extends the current literature on intra-household activity-travel interactions by considering external helps from domestic helpers, which may contribute to the understanding of activity-travel patterns of household members. Article Title: Research on the Practice Education of the International Engineering Management Major under the New Situation
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: International engineering management; Practice education; Financial crisis
Abstract: The practice education of the international engineering management major is a comprehensive training procedure to cultivate students' ability in operating, position adaption, theoretical knowledge application and scientific research. It is also a key route and method to increase the innovation ability and professional quality of the students. It is commonly recognized that the practicing abilities of students in this major are relatively weak. According to the problems occurring in the practice education links like the experimental courses, course design, recognition practice, production practice, graduation practice and graduation design etc., this paper proposes some measures such as innovating practice education mode, establishing practice bases outside universities, strengthening staff construction of teachers etc. These measures can cultivate compound talents under the new situation in which the enrollment expansion continues in universities and the intense competition exists in the talent market of China.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP

Article Title: An Evaluation Method of Green Construction based on DEA Cross-evaluation
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Green construction; Evaluating; DEA cross-evaluation model
Abstract: Green construction has been the inevitable trend of construction technology development, and the development direction of the construction industry. The implementation of green construction has been not only an important measure to promote the sustainable development of the construction industry, but also an inherent requirement for building a resource-saving and environment-friendly society. It is helpful to evaluate and improve green construction by establishing effective evaluation system and selecting appropriate evaluation method of green construction. According to the implementation contents of green construction, comprehensive evaluation index system of green construction is established in this paper. Because DEA method has any advantages in a multi-input multi-output model, the comprehensive evaluation model of green construction based on DEA cross-evaluation is structured. Examples show that the method has higher scientificalness and effectiveness applying to green construction evaluation. It provides a new and effective evaluation method of inspecting and evaluating the implementation effect of green construction and promoting green construction continuous improvement.

Article Title: Selection and Evaluation of Intelligent Residential Communities Using Value Engineering in China
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Residential community; Intelligent system; Value engineering; Function analysis; Life cycle cost
Abstract: Now intelligent systems are commonly used in residential communities in China, stimulated by the development of information technology and increasingly sophisticated demand for more comfortable and convenient living environment. Achieving end-user satisfaction and optimizing the total value of an intelligent system design is a major goal of building owners and developers. A multitude of products/options with varying costs can be used to create alternatives that meet the design objectives. Owners have to carefully select the most optimum design alternative that combines the most valuable options and realize the design objectives within the project budget. This paper presents a method to help buildings' owners and developers identify the most valuable intelligent system design alternative. The proposed approach uses Value Engineering (VE) methodology to calculate value parameter for each alternative. Firstly, by pinpointing the relevance and suitability of the existing standards of intelligent system functions and specifications used in residential communities in China, three levels of system functions are identified. By using the simple arithmetic measure, Function parameter of each alternative is calculated. Considering all significant costs over the economic life of each alternative added compared to the conventional counterparts, Cost parameter of each alternative is derived. Thereafter, the derived function and cost parameters are combined to measure how well a particular alternative achieves the requirements taking into account its overall cost. Therefore, it can be concluded that the proposed approach helps owners and developers identify the final value of intelligent residential communities so as to optimize decision and support evaluation.

Article Title: Economic Analysis on Sustainable Housing Practiced in China
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: sustainable; green eco-house; economic; life cycle
Abstract: With the global environmental problems getting worsen than ever before, basic concept of sustainable development has become gradually accepted throughout the world. In the field of residential construction, as a typical model of sustainable housing in China, green housing or green ecological residence (the definition is not unanimous) has taken a first step moving toward reality though there are many obstacles on the road. In order to speed up the tempo of sustainable housing in China, proposals and measures should be advanced to deal with restrictions to decrease energy consumption and reduce environmental damage. This paper studies on the mechanism of internal motivation and external impetus from view of economics to solve restrictive factors of sustainable housing in China from three aspects: developers' lacking of motivation, consumers' insufficient understanding on green house and the indetermination of government function. It is widely believed that sustainable building is more expensive than standard building practice, which leads to shortage of motivation on green housing development The paper disproves this assumption and demonstrates that sustainable building could be financially profitable, and more countermeasures are advocated to use this positive financial aspect Moreover, as a part of the inner motive, life cycle cost analysis method is introduced to help consumers changing their views of selecting and utilizing house as well as changing their lifestyle. To resolve externality problems, government should take on responsibilities and bear some of the cost to offer basic conditions for market working. Reasonable government actions, as the main impetus, should be alternatively advanced to restrict, guide or offer incentives of market behavior to improve the progress of sustainable housing in China.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: A Primary Exploration of Risk Management in International Projects
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: International project; Risk; Evaluation indicator system; Selection of professional contractors
Abstract: International project undertaking is a sort of venture business, in which the contractors will be confronted with more complicated environments and higher risks than in domestic markets. These risks mainly involve incorrect decision risks, contracting and performance risks, liability risks etc. Currently many Chinese construction enterprises lack experience in management of international project undertaking, and quite a number of enterprises are blind to potential risks of projects. To respond to international market competition, the enterprises have to analyze and study the class and value of the risks inherent in international projects carefully, establish relevant specific countermeasures pertinently, and take scientific management measures in an attempt to reduce, or transfer and spread risks, and thus occupy a favorable position in the international competition. To manage risks, firstly should identify risks, and study the probability and pattern of occurrence of risk events. Risk identification is a complicated and delicate job, so it's very important to follow specific procedures and steps, and use advanced methods to analyze each event by stages and layers, and conduct assessment practically and realistically. Secondly, it should discern and repeatedly compare each factor possibly leading to risks; make presumptions and judgment on each tendency or trend; and evaluate each internal or external factor and variable of a specific enterprise or project. In the whole process of a project's life cycle, there may appear all sorts of uncertainties, and these uncertainties will have positive or negative effects on the realization of the project's objectives. An analysis of project risks is to analyze and assess each kind of uncertainties to be arisen and their effects probably caused, and the extent of the effects appropriately. Through disclosing the effects of risks, the enterprises can analyze their potential risks and assess capabilities, and take relevant countermeasures, and thus attain the purpose of reducing the adverse effects of risks, or cutting down the probability of occurrence of risks. A project risk indicator is an important content to reflect the risk profile of a construction project and conduct risk analyses. It can select project risk indicators according to different dimensions of research, and for an international project, the risk indicator system mainly comprises the cost risk indicator, the construction period risk indicator and the financial risk indicator. This article will build a project risk evaluation indicator system by combined use of the expert survey method and the Monte Carlo simulation method. Since project completion risks may be transferred to subcontractors through contracts for project undertaking such as by the form of fixed-price turn-key contract, it is vital to evaluate the credit, experience, technology, and management of subcontractors etc. However, only emphasizing the transfer of completion risks from one party to another cannot solve the problem fundamentally, and the real dissolution of risks lies in the correct selection of subcontractors. This article will build a subcontractor multi-objective selection decision model targeting at professional contractor selection risks in international project undertaking, and make an in-depth study of risk management in international project undertaking.

Authors: Liu, W; Liu, LQ; Ma, ZS
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Liu Wei; Liu Liqun; Ma Zhanshan
Article Title: Commercial Real Estate Research under the Global Financial Crisis
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: financial crisis; commercial real estate; investment risk; building economy; counter measures
Abstract: China's commercial real estate development is relatively lagging behind, in the late 80 century in Beijing,Shanghai,Guangzhou presented the large-scale Department store, in the mid-90s based on introduction of dining, entertainment and other facilities,formed the small-scale shopping center. The arrival of the global financial crisis, China's real estate industry experienced a severe test. Commercial real estate development and management is the most challenging, it is full of risk with high reward,complexity and specialized high requirements, commercial real estate as a high-capital-intensive industries is bound to face the global financial crisis risk, but the Stable returns of commercial real estate will also become a safe haven. This paper reviews the history of the development of commercial real estate in China, analysis of the global financial crisis on the impact of commercial real estate, and through market research it proposes the development of commercial real estate measures under the financial crisis, it is looking ahead to a prosperous commercial real estate. This article thinks of the Chinese commercial real estate development features, offeres proposals and suggestions for the present stage China commercial real estate development.

Article Title: Ecological Informatics: Current Scope and Future Directions
Book Series Title: Environmental Science and Engineering
Conference Title: 4th International ICSC Symposium on Information Technologies in Environmental Engineering
Conference Sponsor: ICSC
Keywords Plus: ARTIFICIAL NEURAL-NETWORKS; PREDICTION; CLIMATE; LAKES; EUTROPHICATION; COMMUNITIES; ECOSYSTEMS; EVOLUTION; ABUNDANCE; ALIGNMENT
Abstract: Ecological informatics emerges as a new discipline that studies principles of information processing in ecosystems as well as data analysis and synthesis for hind- and forecasting of ecosystems. It also focuses on integration and sharing of ecological data from genomic to landscape levels at different spatial scales by web-based data warehousing, GIS and remote sensing. Ecological informatics takes advantage of steadily advancing computational technology in order to better cope with extreme complexity and distinct nonlinearity of ecological data. It utilises cellular automata, neural, evolutionary and immunological computing to unravel ecological complexity as well as explain and forecast ecosystem responses to habitat and climate change.

Authors: Ren, XY; Li, X; Liu, LB
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Ren Xiangyang; Li Xin; Liu Libo
Article Title: Unascertained Measure Method on the Regional Technological Innovation Ability
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Regional technological innovation ability; Index system; Unascertained measure; Information entropy
Abstract: In market economics, the regional technological innovation ability has become a very important factor in effecting the region's lasting, rapid and healthy development. So, the quality of the technological innovation ability has related to the future development directly. The paper analysis's the affecting factors of regional technological innovation ability firstly. Then, the appraisal index system of regional technological innovation ability is established. The index system contains five second degree indexes of technological innovation input ability, technological innovation collocation ability, technological innovation supporting ability, technological innovation management ability and technological innovation output ability and 33 detailed indexes. And then, the distinguishments of regional technological innovation ability and other technological innovation ability are researched. On the basis of the above analyses, the paper establishes the appraisal model of regional technological innovation ability based on information entropy and unascertained measurement. At last, an example is given to verify the model. The paper's research is an attempt on regional development and has important theory meaning and application value.

Authors: Wang, PP; Zhou, ZP; Li, QM; Deng, XP
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Wang Panpan; Zhou Zhipeng; Li Qiming; Deng Xiaopeng
Article Title: Analysis of Construction Workers Safety Competencies Model
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: safety competencies; model; construction workers; safety management
Abstract: Construction remains one of the high-risk industries and occupations over a long period of time and reducing injuries and accidents has been a prime focus of government organizations for many years. Research efforts have focused on developing accident causation models to unearth root cause of accidents. Nevertheless, despite the contribution of construction accident causation models, accidents occur. The first point of contact of accidents is inevitably the construction workers and their unsafe behaviors, which are the immediate factors leading to the accidents as demonstrated in the accident causation models, are just the external performance of lack of safety competencies. To develop a model of construction workers safety competencies to demonstrate how construction works to be completed safely is the primary purpose of the paper. A detailed literature review of competencies definition and competencies models is firstly conducted. Then, the definition of construction workers safety competencies is identified and the model of construction workers safety competencies is established in accordance with its relationship with the behavior and safety performance. Finally, the model is used to analyze the safety competencies demonstrated by the construction worker involved in an accident recorded in the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) safety incidents database of United States. This paper is a pilot study of the construction workers safety competencies and could serve as a starting point and foundation for further researches focusing on safety competencies on construction sites.

Authors: Wang, XX; Li, QM; Yuan, JF
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Wang Xiaoxiao; Li Qiming; Yuan Jingfeng
Article Title: Comparative Analysis of Project Acquiring Conditions between US and China
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: bidding; acquiring procedure; engineering guarantee; successful tender conditions
Abstract: The present financial crisis results to the poor state of the U.S. construction market, which provide a rare opportunity for Chinese contractors to have their great-leap-forward development in U.S. market. Therefore, the comparative analysis of the conditions to project acquisition between U.S. and China becomes especially important. By comparison, we could better understand the customary practice of developed countries and grasp the rules and procedures in U.S. construction market, which will help the Chinese contractors to improve competitiveness in the international project contracting market. Using bidding method to decide the contractors is a general convention in the international construction market, which is also the most direct route to obtain the project both in the United States and in China. Taking bidding mode as the main line, project acquiring methods, operation processes, and successful tender conditions in US and China were compared and analyzed in this paper, which would help to deepen understanding the conventional practices of Western developed countries. Studying on relevant case, countermeasures and suggestions were also provided to Chinese contractors in the paper, in order to improve their international competitiveness and to facilitate the more effective access to the U.S. construction market.

Adopt Complex Adaptive System (CAS) as the research framework of safe support system. Define the composition agents of safety support system and develop the research of its CAS characteristics from the following aspects of aggregation, non-linear, flow and diversity.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Wu, X. Y.; Li, H. M.
Article Title: Unascertained set decision-making model for selection of project delivery system
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Project delivery system; unascertained measure; information entropy
Abstract: The construction project is implemented under uncertainty environment, and the product of construction is very complexity. Selecting an appropriate project delivery method is one of the key factors determining the success of a project and a critical task,which determines the project schedule, quality and investment objectives. To increase the chances of project success, owners must choose appropriate project delivery system to meet their needs. This study proposed a decision-making model for the selection of project delivery system which is based on information entropy and unascertained measure model. In order to overcome the subjective evaluations from the experts, the theory of 'entropy weight' is applied to modify the experts' subjective weight. The multi-attribute unascertained measure decision- making is fitted to deal with the uncertainty information for selection of project delivery system. The application of the model in a real-world practice was provided. The methodology proposed a effective way for the owners to select a appropriate delivery system for their project in the uncertainty condition.

Authors: Xu, B; Chen, JJ; Ji, YB
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Xu, B.; Chen, J. J.; Ji, Y. B.
Article Title: Analysis on the Development Condition of Construction Industrialization in China
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Development conditions; Construction industrialization; Policy suggestion
Abstract: It is considered that construction industrialization is an inevitable trend in construction industry. The experience of other counties indicates that shortened construction period, higher engineering quality, labor productivity improvement, energy saving and emission reduction could be achieved by construction industrialization. Therefore, the development of construction industrialization has been considered to be especially important. However, the progress of construction industrialization in China was quite slow. Compared with developed countries and regions, there is still a wide gap In this paper, the reason for the slow development of construction industrialization in China was analyzed from the following aspects by using the statistical method: the market demand, technological level, enterprise management level and policy environment. The paper concludes that the main constraints of China's construction industrialization development are the level of economical development, industrial design standardization, the capability of component supply, the level of construction mechanization and policy guidance as well. Meanwhile, Comparing with that in other countries, the paper analyzed the advantages and weaknesses of construction industrialization development in China, and proposed suggestions to speed up the development of construction industrialization in China.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP

Article Title: Study on Application of Successful Degree and Fuzzy Comprehensive Evaluation Method to Construction Engineering Project Post-Evaluation
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Construction engineering project; Post-evaluation; The evaluation of successful degree; Fuzzy comprehensive evaluation
Abstract: The evaluation of successful degree is commonly used for construction projects post-evaluation, this method uses qualitative analysis, so it results are subjective, one-sided. The evaluation of successful degree is to assess a comprehensive evaluation of the results of the assessment to the indicators of successful degree of construction projects to make a decisive conclusion rely on the experience of the experts, which is commonly known as the scoring method. This article uses the fuzzy comprehensive evaluation in the evaluation of successful degree, putting forward the successful degree and fuzzy comprehensive evaluation method to construction engineering project post-evaluation. The successful -degree of fuzzy comprehensive evaluation method using fuzzy math and fuzzy comprehensive evaluation of construction projects the principle of assessment after the success of the use of assessment to improve the method, examples show that the method is effective to improve the success of the deficiency assessment method, the method of science, a simple, intuitive and feasible, the results of the assessment objective, comprehensive and accurate.

Article Title: The Pricing Strategies on China's Green Food Products at Growth Stage of Industrial Life Cycle
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)

Author Keywords: green food; industrial life cycle; awareness; pricing strategies
Abstract: According to industry life cycle theory, as well as the current industrial development situation, this study proposed that green food industry in China was at its growth stage. Although consumer at this stage has increasing awareness toward green products, the problem of information asymmetry as well as limited purchasing power, hinders their willingness to pay at premium for green products, which in turn results in an awkward dilemma for the pricing practice of green firm. Based on the characteristics of consumer behaviors at growth stage, we discussed some practical suggestions on firm's pricing strategies.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Fuzzy Synthetic Assessment of Deep Foundation Construction Risk in River-cross Power Tunnel Project of Shanghai
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Construction Risk of Deep Foundation Pit; Risk Identification; Fuzzy Synthetic Assessment; River-crossing Power Tunnel Project of Shanghai
Abstract: With the development of urban construction, the deep excavation technology is used in a large number of underground engineering. Due to the increasing scale of construction project, the construction technology and environment are becoming increasingly sophisticated, and the deep excavation is difficult. The power tunnel project under Huangpu River is one of the shanghai government planning municipal projects, and the construction of deep foundation pit is the key step. To the features of construction risk, this paper first applied the fault tree method to distinguish the construction risk and set up the risk detailed list, and assessed the risk grade by using fuzzy synthetic analysis model. The research result shows that this method is feasible, and consistent with the practical construction. By strengthening the precipitation control of confined water and the synchronization monitoring of the surrounding buildings and municipal pipeline settlement, the overall risk levels will be reduced to moderate level or bellow, and to ensure the smooth completion of the project.

Article Title: A Fuzzy Factor Analysis Model for Analyzing the Factors Affecting Safety Cost of Construction Enterprises
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Construction enterprise; Construction safety cost; Fuzzy Factor Analysis Model; Common factors
Abstract: The massive casualties and huge economic losses have been caused by various construction safety accidents. Enterprises are main undertakers for safety incident costs. They are facing with huge economic risks. In order to manage this kind of risk, it is essential to study the key factors leading to safety costs in construction enterprises. The result is seriously affected by interference information in Classical Factor Analysis. To deal with this problem, a Fuzzy Factor Analysis Model (FFAM) is proposed in this research. By using the FFAM, effects of interference information can be greatly reduced, and the result will be more accurate by iterative computation in FFAM. In this paper, 8 common factors, among the 26 factors affecting the safety cost of construction enterprises, are obtained by using the FFAM developed. The findings demonstrate that the proposed FFAM can not only facilitate the objective of safety cost management, but also improve the efficiency of activities for safety cost management.

Article Title: Congestion analysis of waterborne, containerized imports from Asia to the United States
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Congestion analysis; Intermodal freight transport; Transportation planning; Containerized imports; Queuing
Keywords Plus: DECISION-SUPPORT-SYSTEM; OPERATIONS-RESEARCH; OPTIMIZATION; ALLOCATION; MODELS; MANAGEMENT
Abstract: A queuing model is introduced for estimating container flow times through port terminals as a function of infrastructure, staffing, and import volume. The model is statistically calibrated on industry data. Flow-time estimates of the model are aggregated with estimates from models previously developed for rail networks to develop estimates of the total container flow times from West Coast ports to inland distribution centers. Integrated with a supply-chain optimization model, the queuing formulas are used to predict import flows by port and landside channel in scenarios of total import growth, varying all-water rates, and a higher import share for nation-wide importers. Article Title: The maximum approximate composite marginal likelihood (MACML) estimation of multinomial probit-based unordered response choice models
Author Keywords: Multinomial probit; Mixed models; Composite marginal likelihood; Discrete choice models; Spatial econometrics; Panel data
Keywords Plus: TRAVEL-TIME RELIABILITY; PAIRWISE LIKELIHOOD; SIMULATED LIKELIHOOD; BINARY; FORMULATION; INFERENCE; PROBABILITIES; PREFERENCES; INTEGRATION; REGRESSION
Abstract: The likelihood functions of multinomial probit (MNP)-based choice models entail the evaluation of analytically-intractable integrals. As a result, such models are usually estimated using maximum simulated likelihood (MSL) techniques. Unfortunately, for many practical situations, the computational cost to ensure good asymptotic MSL estimator properties can be prohibitive and practically infeasible as the number of dimensions of integration rises. In this paper, we introduce a maximum approximate composite marginal likelihood (MACML) estimation approach for MNP models that can be applied using simple optimization software for likelihood estimation. It also represents a conceptually and pedagogically simpler procedure relative to simulation techniques, and has the advantage of substantial computational time efficiency relative to the MSL approach. The paper provides a blue-print for the MACML estimation for a wide variety of MNP models. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Intermodal hub-and-spoke network design: Incorporating multiple stakeholders and multi-type containers
Author Keywords: Intermodal transportation; Hub-and-spoke network design; User equilibrium; Multi-type containers; Genetic algorithm
Keywords Plus: ARC LOCATION-PROBLEMS; PRODUCTIVITY GROWTH; MEDIAN PROBLEM; ALGORITHMS; MODEL; TRANSPORTATION; FORMULATIONS; EQUILIBRIUM; CAPACITY; DEMAND
Abstract: This paper develops a mathematical program with equilibrium constraints (MPEC) model for the intermodal hub-and-spoke network design (IHSND) problem with multiple stake-holders and multi-type containers. The model incorporates a parametric variational inequality (VI) that formulates the user equilibrium (UE) behavior of intermodal operators in route choice for any given network design decision of the network planner. The model also uses a cost function that is capable of reflecting the transition from scale economies to scale diseconomies in distinct flow regimes for carriers or hub operators, and a disutility function integrating actual transportation charges and congestion impacts for intermodal operators. To solve the MPEC model, a hybrid genetic algorithm (HGA) embedded with a diagonalization method for solving the parametric VI is proposed. Finally, the comparative analysis of the HGA and an exhaustive enumeration algorithm indicates a good performance of the HGA in terms of computational time and solution quality. The HGA is also applied to solve a large-scale problem to show the applicability of the proposed model and algorithm. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Puckett, SM; Hensher, DA; Brooks, MR; Trifts, V
Author Full Names: Puckett, Sean M.; Hensher, David A.; Brooks, Mary R.; Trifts, Valerie
Article Title: Preferences for alternative short sea shipping opportunities
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Freight mode choice; Short sea shipping; Generalised mixed logit; Scale heterogeneity; Preference heterogeneity
Abstract: This paper investigates the role of preference and scale heterogeneity in the mode choice process of shippers in the Atlantic Canada-US eastern seaboard market. The generalised mixed logit model is estimated to account for heterogeneity in preferences for frequency of departure of freight transport services, along with heterogeneity in scale across respondents. The contributions of the paper to the literature are: the revelation of significant preference and scale heterogeneity in the sample; the estimated distribution of shippers' willingness-to-pay for gains in service frequency; and the confirmation that there is merit in accounting for scale heterogeneity in future and revisited choice studies. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: A structural model of safety and safety regulation in the truckload trucking industry
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Trucking; Externalities; Safety; Standards; Liability
Abstract: This paper models public policies to improve safety within a structural model of the truckload trucking industry. The policies are designed to ameliorate the market failures associated with the myopic ignoring of crash costs by some trucking firms, and institutional constraints that prevent full internalization of the costs of crashes. The paper compares two alternative public policies: (1) levying post-crash fines and making shippers bear secondary liability for damages incurred in crashes, and (2) imposition of a minimum safety standard, in conjunction with a requirement to hold insurance, and assessing penalties for non-compliance with the standard. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: A generalized modeling framework to analyze interdependencies among infrastructure systems
Author Keywords: Infrastructure systems interdependencies; Computable general equilibrium; Generalized transportation network; Decision-making
Abstract: Extreme events over the past decade in the USA, ranging from the 9/11 terror attacks to the 2003 Northeast power blackout to the 2005 hurricanes, have highlighted the urgent need to understand the interdependencies among civil infrastructure systems for more effective and efficient planning, design and operations. The need is further highlighted by the challenges arising from the capacity needs of rapid urbanization and the need to renew aging infrastructure. This paper proposes a generalized modeling framework that combines a multilayer network concept with a market-based economic approach to capture the interdependencies among various infrastructure systems with disparate physical and operational characteristics. Thereby, the various infrastructure systems are modeled as individual networks connected through links representing market interactions. The market interactions capture the various types of interdependencies through supply-demand mechanisms. The modeling framework uses a multilayer infrastructure network (MIN) concept, the computable general equilibrium (CGE) theory, and its spatial extension (SCGE), to formulate an equilibrium problem. The mapping between the modeling framework and the real-world context is discussed, followed by a description of the various model components. Numerical experiments are conducted to illustrate the capability of the model to capture various types of interdependencies and to provide insights on the importance of these interdependencies for real-world problems. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Friesz, TL; Kim, T; Kwon, C; Rigdon, MA
Author Full Names: Friesz, Terry L.; Kim, Taeil; Kwon, Changhyun; Rigdon, Matthew A.
Article Title: Approximate network loading and dual-time-scale dynamic user equilibrium
Author Keywords: Dynamic user equilibrium; Differential variational inequalities; Differential algebraic equations; Dual-time-scale; Fixed-point algorithm in Hilbert space
Keywords Plus: VARIATIONAL INEQUALITY FORMULATION; CELL TRANSMISSION MODEL; TRAFFIC ASSIGNMENT; FIXED-POINTS; FLOW; CONSISTENT; WAVES; ROUTE
Abstract: In this paper we present a dual-time-scale formulation of dynamic user equilibrium (DUE) with demand evolution. Our formulation belongs to the problem class that Pang and Stewart (2008) refer to as differential variational inequalities. It combines the within-day time scale for which route and departure time choices fluctuate in continuous time with the day-to-day time scale for which demand evolves in discrete time steps. Our formulation is consistent with the often told story that drivers adjust their travel demands at the end of every day based on their congestion experience during one or more previous days. We show that analysis of the within-day assignment model is tremendously simplified by expressing dynamic user equilibrium as a differential variational inequality. We also show there is a class of day-to-day demand growth models that allow the dual-time-scale formulation to be decomposed by time-stepping to yield a sequence of continuous time, single-day, dynamic user equilibrium problems. To solve the single-day DUE problems arising during time-stepping, it is necessary to repeatedly solve a dynamic network loading problem. We observe that the network loading phase of DUE computation generally constitutes a differential algebraic equation (DAE) system, and we show that the DAE system for network loading based on the link delay model (LDM) of Friesz et al. (1993) may be approximated by a system of ordinary differential equations (ODEs). That system of ODEs, as we demonstrate, may be efficiently solved using traditional numerical methods for such problems. To compute an actual dynamic user equilibrium, we introduce a continuous time fixed-point algorithm and prove its convergence for effective path delay operators that allow a limited type of nonmonotone path delay. We show that our DUE algorithm is compatible with network loading based on the LDM and the cell transmission model (CTM) due to Daganzo (1995). We provide a numerical example based on the much studied Sioux Falls network. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Route swapping in dynamic traffic networks
Author Keywords: Convergence measure; Dynamic traffic assignment; Route swap process
Keywords Plus: ASSIGNMENT MODEL; EQUILIBRIUM; CONVERGENCE; EXISTENCE; TIME; COST
Abstract: A dynamic traffic assignment (DTA) model typically consists of a traffic performance model and a route choice model. The traffic performance model describes how traffic propagates (over time) along routes connecting origin-destination (OD) pairs, examples being the cell transmission model, the vertical queueing model and the travel time model. This is implemented in a dynamic network loading (DNL) algorithm, which uses the given route inflows to compute the link inflows (and hence link costs), which are then used to compute the route travel times (and hence route costs). A route swap process specifies the route inflows for tomorrow (at the next iteration) based on the route inflows today (at the current iteration). A dynamic user equilibrium (DUE), where each traveller on the network cannot reduce his or her cost of travel by switching to another route, can be sought by iterating between the DNL algorithm and the route swap process. The route swap process itself takes up very little computational time (although route set generation can be very computationally intensive for large networks). However, the choice of route swap process dramatically affects convergence and the speed of convergence. The paper details several route swap processes and considers whether they lead to a convergent system, assuming that the route cost vector is a monotone function of the route inflow vector. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: An empirical test of modal choice and allocative efficiency: Evidence from US coal transportation
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Allocative efficiency; Translog cost; Transportation modal choice; Factor of proportionality; Infrastructure constraint; Capacity constraint
Keywords Plus: RAIL; PRODUCTIVITY; COMPETITION; ECONOMIES; INDUSTRY; DEMAND; SCALE
Abstract: A generalized shipper transportation cost function is estimated to test whether coal shippers achieve allocative efficiency with respect to market prices when facing limited access to the full range of transportation services. Findings indicate that allocative efficiency with respect to market prices is achieved when shippers have access to all major transportation modes. In contrast, the condition for allocative efficiency is not met with respect to market prices when shippers' modal choices are limited to trucking and rail services. Findings for the sample of shippers who face limited shipping choices is interpreted as suggesting an over-use of trucks relative to the use of trains due to price distortions of transportation services. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Using conditioning on observed choices to retrieve individual-specific attribute processing strategies
Author Keywords: Stated choice; Attribute processing; Ignoring attributes; Willingness to pay
Abstract: With the growing reliance on Stated Choice (SC) data, researchers are increasingly interested in understanding how respondents process the information presented to them in such surveys. Specifically, it has been argued that some respondents may simplify the choice tasks by consistently ignoring one or more of the attributes describing the alternatives, and direct questions put to respondents after the completion of SC surveys support this hypothesis. However, in the general context of issues with response quality in SC data, there are certainly grounds for questioning the reliability of stated attribute processing strategies. In this paper, we take a different approach by attempting to infer attribute processing strategies through the analysis of respondent-specific coefficient distributions obtained through conditioning on observed choices. Our results suggest that a share of respondents do indeed ignore a subset of explanatory variables. However, there is also some evidence that the inferred attribute processing strategies are not necessarily consistent with the stated attribute processing strategies. Additionally, there is some evidence that respondents who claim to have ignored a certain attribute may simply have assigned it lesser importance. The results produced by the inferring approach not only lead to slightly better fit but also more consistent results. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: A spatial dynamic panel model with random effects applied to commuting times
Author Keywords: Spatial correlation; Dynamic panels; MCMC estimations
Abstract: A space-time filter is set forth for spatial panel data situations that include random effects. We propose a general spatial dynamic specification that encompasses several spatiotemporal models previously used in the panel data literature. We apply the model to the case of highway induced travel demand. The theory of induced travel demand asserts that increased highway capacity will induce growth in traffic for a number of reasons. Our model allows us to quantify the spatial spillover impacts of increased highway capacity at one location in the network on travel times in neighboring locations and in future time periods. (c) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Author Full Names: Angeloudis, Panagiotis; Bell, Michael G. H.
Article Title: An uncertainty-aware AGV assignment algorithm for automated container terminals
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: AGV; Optimisation; Container terminal; Uncertainty
Abstract: This paper studies job assignments for automated guided in container terminal settings under various conditions of uncertainty. An introduction to their operation is provided, along with a flexible dispatching algorithm, suitable for real-time control of AGVs. Using these concepts a new AGV dispatching approach is developed, capable of operating under uncertain conditions within a detailed container terminal model. Several performance indicators are presented, focused on generic features of vehicle operations as well the assessment of uncertainty levels inside the terminal. From the results of the simulation experiments, it is found that the proposed technique outperforms well known heuristics and alternative algorithms. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Outsourcing distribution and logistics services within the automotive supplier industry
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Transaction cost economics; Resource-based view; Outsourcing; Logistics
Keywords Plus: RESOURCE-BASED VIEW; COMPETITIVE ADVANTAGE; AGENCY THEORY; TRANSACTION COST; FIRM; MODEL; STRATEGY; ORGANIZATION; PERFORMANCE; GOVERNANCE
Abstract: This paper reports on an empirical study that examined a suite of distribution and logistics services commonly used to manage inbound materials en route to plants. The sourcing decision is examined through the lenses of transaction cost economics and the resource-based view of the firm and the results lend limited support for both theories in the context of such services. Results further indicate that there is little evidence supporting differences between internal versus external decision-makers. Published by Elsevier Ltd.

Article Title: Container fleet sizing and empty repositioning in liner shipping systems
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Fleet sizing; Empty container repositioning; Threshold control policy; Genetic Algorithms; Evolutionary Strategy; Stochastic; Simulation
Keywords Plus: ALLOCATION PROBLEM; FREIGHT TRANSPORTATION; SERVICE SYSTEMS; NETWORK DESIGN; MANAGEMENT; MODELS; PORT
Abstract: This paper considers the joint container fleet sizing and empty container repositioning problem in multi-vessel, multi-port and multi-voyage shipping systems with dynamic, uncertain and imbalanced customer demands. The objective is to minimize the expected total costs including inventory-holding costs, lifting-on/lifting-off costs, transportation costs, repositioning costs. and lost-sale penalty costs. A simulation-based optimization tool is developed to optimize the container fleet size and the parameterized empty repositioning policy simultaneously. The optimization procedure is based on Genetic Algorithms and Evolutionary Strategy combined with an adjustment mechanism. Case studies are given to demonstrate the results. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. Article Title: Consolidation effects: Whether and how inventories should be pooled
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Consolidation effect; Total cost; Service level; Regular transshipment; Inventory centralization; Independent system
Keywords Plus: EMERGENCY LATERAL TRANSSHIPMENTS; SQUARE-ROOT LAW; CENTRALIZATION; SYSTEMS; COSTS
Abstract: This paper presents a framework for deciding whether and how inventories should be pooled, using the consolidation effect as a cornerstone tool to measure inventory costs, service levels, and total costs. Based on the random generation of different scenarios, it is indicated the adequacy of inventory centralization, regular transshipments, and independent systems to a given set of demand, lead time, and holding costs characteristics. Sensitivity analyses on mathematical expressions are performed to determine when one alternative is preferable in terms of total costs. Real settings are also presented in light of the framework developed. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Pinjari, AR; Bhat, CR; Hensher, DA
Author Full Names: Pinjari, Abdul Rawoof; Bhat, Chandra R.; Hensher, David A.
Article Title: Residential self-selection effects in an activity time-use behavior model
Author Keywords: Residential location choice; Residential self-selection; Time-use; Multiple Discrete-Continuous Extreme; Value model; Integrated land-use transportation modeling
Keywords Plus: OUT-OF-HOME; TRAVEL BEHAVIOR; BUILT ENVIRONMENT; ACTIVITY PARTICIPATION; MULTILEVEL ANALYSIS; NEIGHBORHOOD TYPE; CHOICE MODELS; URBAN TRAVEL; LAND-USE; IN-HOME
Abstract: This study presents a joint model system of residential location and activity time-use choices that considers a comprehensive set of activity-travel environment (ATE) variables, as well as socio-demographic variables, as determinants of individual weekday activity time-use choices. The model system takes the form of a joint mixed Multinomial Logit-Multiple Discrete-Continuous Extreme Value (MNL-MDCEV) structure that (a) accommodates differential sensitivity to the ATE attributes due to both observed and unobserved individual-related attributes, and (b) controls for the self-selection of individuals into neighborhoods due to both observed and unobserved individual-related factors. The joint model system is estimated on a sample of 2793 households and individuals residing in Alameda County in the San Francisco Bay Area. The model results indicate the significant presence of residential self-selection effects due to both observed and unobserved individual-related factors. For instance, individuals from households with more bicycles are associated with a higher preference for out-of-home physically active pure recreational travel pursuits (such as bicycling around in the neighborhood). These same individuals locate into neighborhoods with good bicycling facilities. This leads to a non-causal association between individuals' time investment in out-of-home physically active pure recreational travel and bicycling facilities in their residential neighborhoods. Thus, ignoring the effect of bicycle ownership in the time-use model, would lead to an inflated estimate of the effect of bicycling facility density on the time invested in physically active pure recreational travel. Similarly, there are significant unobserved individual factors that lead to a high preference for physically active recreational activities and also make individuals locate in areas with good bicycling facilities. When such unobserved factors were controlled by the proposed joint residential location and time-Use model, the impact of bicycling facility density on out-of-home physically active recreational activities ceased to be statistically significant (from being statistically significant in the independent time-use model). These results highlight the need to control for residential self-selection effects when estimating the effects of the activity-travel environment on activity time-use choices. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Huang, CC; Liang, WY; Lin, SH
Author Full Names: Huang, Chun Che; Liang, Wen Yau; Lin, Shian Hua
Article Title: An agile approach for supply chain modeling
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Supply chain modeling; Agility; Generic label correcting algorithm; Rough set
Keywords Plus: ROUGH SET-THEORY; FEATURE-SELECTION; TRANSPORTATION; NETWORKS; DESIGN
Abstract: This paper proposes the generic label correcting (GLC) algorithm incorporated with the decision rules to solve supply chain modeling problems. The rough set theory is applied to reduce the complexity of data space and to induct decision rules. This proposed approach is agile because by combining various operators and comparators, different types of paths in the reduced networks can be solved with one algorithm. Furthermore, the four cases of the supply chain modeling are illustrated. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Bliemer, MCJ; Rose, JM; Hensher, DA
Author Full Names: Bliemer, Michiel C. J.; Rose, John M.; Hensher, David A.
Article Title: Efficient stated choice experiments for estimating nested logit models
Author Keywords: Stated choice; Efficient experimental designs; Nested logit; Sample size
Abstract: The allocation of combinations of attribute levels to choice situations in stated choice (SC) experiments can have a significant influence upon the resulting study outputs once data is collected. Recently, a small but growing stream of research has looked at using what have become known as efficient SC experimental designs to allocate the attribute levels to choice situations in a manner designed to produce better model outcomes. This research stream has shown that the use of efficient SC designs can lead to improvements in the reliability of parameter estimates derived from discrete choice models estimated on SC data for a given sample size. Unlike orthogonal designs, however, efficient SC experiments are generated in such a manner that their efficiency is related to the econometric model that is most likely to be estimated once the choice data is collected. To date, most of the research on efficient SC designs has assumed an MNL model format. In this paper, we generate efficient SC experiments for Nested logit models and compare and contrast these with designs specifically generated assuming an MNL model form. We find that the overall efficiency of the design is maximized only when the model assumed in generating the design is the model that is fitted during estimation. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: The Growth Capacity Recognition and Evaluation Model of the Real Estate Business
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Real Estate Enterprises; Growth Capacity; Identification Model; Evaluation Model
Abstract: Growth capacity is the basis for sustained growth and the source of lasting competitive advantage of real estate enterprises,it plays a fundamental role in identifying market opportunities, enhance quality, against market risks, adapting to environmental change. Identification and evaluation is a prerequisite for the further improvement and development such capacity. This paper analyzes the connotation of growth capacity in real estate enterprises in reviewing the relevant theoretical literature, builds its identification model from three angles and evaluation model by fuzzy theory from three dimensions, and finds the growth capacity of Vanke Group as an example to, come in a strong rating through the identification and evaluation. The model can be used in other industries to identify and evaluate growth capacity.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Urban development and the Summer Olympics: a review of the literature
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Mega-event strategy; Summer Olympics; urban development process; sustainable development
Keywords Plus: MEGA-EVENTS; SPORTS; OBJECTIVES; CITIES; SYDNEY; GAMES
Abstract: There is increasing interest in 'mega-event' strategies and their impact on host cities. Organising large-scale urban events, such as the Olympics or World Fairs, has become a deliberate urban policy strategy for promoting local economic growth and putting the host city on the global map. To date, few studies have comprehensively addressed the use of mega-event strategies in area- and urban development processes. This paper intends to fill in this gap, by evaluating the extent to which mega-event strategies have acted as catalysts for urban development processes in Olympic host cities. Furthermore, the paper questions the extent to which mega-event strategies can lead to sustainable development that balances economic, social, and environmental issues, both in the short- and in the long-term.

Authors: Deng, XP; Huang, ZY; Zheng, YL; Yuan, JF
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Deng Xiaopeng; Huang Zhi-ye; Zheng Yan-lu; Yuan Jingfeng
Article Title: Risk Identification and Analysis in PPP Projects
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Public Private Partnership (PPP); Risk Factor; Risk management
Abstract: Risks present at all stages in the process of implementing public-private partnership (PPP) projects which were usually considered as being subject to more risks than traditional forms of public procurement because of there complexity and the coordination of a wide range of disparate and interrelated activities. It was for the interests of the participants to ensure that the project risks were effectively managed. In this paper, risks were identified by reference to systematic/non-systematic risk categories and risks based on different phases of the PPPs. Interaction between the various risks in implementing PPPs was shown and major risks were analyzed. The research findings presented valuable reference to both the public and private partners involved for managing risks concerning the implementation of PPPs.

Book Editors: Athanasiadis, IN; Mitkas, PA; Rizzoli, AE; Gomez, JM
Article Title: A web-based information system rating regional projects by considering sustainable development
Book Series Title: Environmental Science and Engineering
Conference Title: 4th International ICSC Symposium on Information Technologies in Environmental Engineering
Conference Sponsor: ICSC
Abstract: Sustainable Development is more and more requested by society. This also has effects on regionally planned projects, which have to implicate social, ecological, and economic factors in their planning and development processes. Such a project development supports the preservation of entrepreneurial interests as well as the public interests. In consequence of the complexity regarding the evaluation of such projects, there is a need for supporting systems for administration as well as for displaying the actual sustainable state in a region. These supporting systems should integrate both decision support systems and multicriterial analyses. Additional functions should integrate a public participation in the decision-making process. So far there is no distinct solution for these problems in one central system available.

Authors: Kong, DD; Hou, KY; Wang, L
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Kong Dandan; Hou Kunyang; Wang Ling
Article Title: Housing Market Expectation and Price Bubble
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Housing market; Public expectation; Price bubble
Abstract: Since the new century, housing market has been booming in China, which has caused wide concern of the government and scholars, and arguments about housing price bubble seemed to be unceasing. Theoretical and historical experience tells us that price bubble in the market can not persist. Rapid increases of housing price are one aspect of the bubble, but the mere fact of rapid price growth itself is not the conclusive evidence of a bubble. The inspection of the bubble in housing market must be based on the correct analysis of public expectations. In this paper, the forming of housing market expectations and influences on price are examined on the basis of the investigation of agents in housing market. The results indicate that people's expectations can partly explain the trend of housing price in Tianjin in recent years and the public expectations can be easily influenced by informal information, which causes the herd behavioral. Therefore the government should establish authoritative public information platform, release the relevant information of city planning, land exploitation and housing transactions in time and guide public expectations of housing market correctly.

Author Full Names: Li, H. M.; Yan, R. Q.
Article Title: Study on Evaluation Indexes of Recycling for Old Industrial Buildings Based on the Theory of Sustainable Development
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: sustainable development theory; the old industrial buildings; recycling; evaluation indexes
Abstract: Recycling of old industrial buildings has become an important one in the process of the strategy of sustainable development in the city (town). The projects of recycling of old industrial buildings gradually increased in domestic; however, there is no complete system of the Evaluation theory to guide the process of recycling. Reference for the sustainable development evaluation system sustainability of new buildings, and combined with the characteristics of the old industrial buildings, to establish initially the evaluation indexes of old industrial buildings based on the theory of sustainable development. Based on the sustained promoting of recycling of the old industrial buildings and the theory of sustainable development, drawing on relevant evaluation system for construction, in view of the characteristics of recycling of the old industrial buildings, study and obtain the evaluation indexes of recycling of old industrial buildings, to definite and identified the projects of recycling of the old industrial buildings, then provide a theoretical basis for comprehensive and healthy development of recycling of the old industrial buildings in China.

Authors: Li, LT; Li, FK; Ren, XH; Tang, HQ
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Li, L. T.; Li, F. K.; Ren, X. H.; Tang, H. Q.
Article Title: An Study on Influence Factors of Intensive Urban Land Use
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Intensive land use; Influence factor; Mechanism; Correlation analysis; Liaoning province
Abstract: The rapid development of economy and society promotes the demand for construction land. The contradiction between people and land becomes increasingly acute. The realization of intensive urban construction land use is an effective way to ensure the economic and social sustainable development. In order to ease the man-land conflicts and improve the degree of intensive land use, it is necessary to get a clear understanding to the influence factors and the action mechanism, and identify the dominant factors. Based on the economic, social and ecological factors impacting intensive land use, the thesis constructs a theoretical analysis framework of the influence mechanism in intensive land use, and uses the social, economic and land-use data during 1998-2007 in Liaoning province to make correlation analysis between intensive urban land use and its influence factors. The results of the study show that: the level of economic development, capital investment and the level of urbanization are the most important factors influencing intensive urban land use in Liaoning province during the period.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Li, Q.; Wen, S. H. Y.
Article Title: Implementation of a Simulation-based Curriculum to Ease the Transition from School Training to Post-internship for Construction Major
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Vocational education; Simulation; Curriculum; Construction major; Post-internship
Abstract: To fill the gap between school training to post-internship and prepare better qualified students, A simulation-based curriculum for construction major students to ease this transition is developed. The post cluster of the construction major students will engage in after their graduation was first investigated. Then the professional knowledge and capability which current construction profession request are analyzed. Following that, four kind of capability, namely, reading, construction, calculation and management are summarized. Simulation-based curriculum focuses on training students these four capabilities therefore developed with the aid of computer. The trainees were given access to the curriculum and asked to provide feedback regarding the effectiveness of the Curriculum. A questionnaire survey was also conducted to explore the validation of the curriculum. Results showed that students are more flexible and more adaptive to new environment. Confusions of students at the early stage of the post-internship are vanished. Simulation-based Curriculum created a real and effective practical teaching and learning environment.

Authors: Liu, ZJ; Wang, W; Liu, WD
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Liu, Z. J.; Wang, W.; Liu, W. D.
Article Title: Study of Construction Supply Chain Management Framework
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: CSCM; System; Structure
Abstract: Researches on Supply chain management application of construction industry have spread out gradually in China in recent years. But it is still very fragmented and preliminary. Separated and specific studies have not lead to a systematic framework. This article analyzes the development of construction industry and its existing problems, explains the significance of study on construction supply chain management framework and analyzes its structure and scope in details. It is pointed out that the framework of construction supply chain management should include three main aspects. The first is fundamental theories study of construction supply chain management, such as: Williamson's transaction cost theory, public goods management theory, the principal-agent theory, corporate governance theory, corporate resource and capacity theory and etc. The second is researches on construction supply chain management application methods and models, including work flow management (preparation work, time, laborers, space, materials, equipments, connecting work, construction conditions), capital flow management (vertical financing, lateral financing, capital market), information flow management (data, information, knowledge), value flow management (building life cycle value management, project management methods, internal management of corporate). The third is performance evaluation study of construction supply chain management, including the research of the evaluation indicator system and evaluation methods about market or environment, construction companies and construction projects. Study of construction supply chain management framework is very important. It would lead to a systematic study on supply chain management theory application in construction industry, improve application of foreign construction supply chain management experience and research results, enhance the confidence of construction business community and government for supply chain management theory, maintain the order of construction market and sustainable healthy development of construction industry.

Article Title: Research on the Application of QFD in Residence Energy-saving Design
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Quality function deployment(QFD); Quality house ( Q H ); Residence energy-saving design; Residence energy-saving standard
Abstract: With rapid development of economy in Zhejiang Province, there are increasingly urgent demands for energy and economic resources. Residents' demands for a better thermal environment are increased and heating and air conditioning become even more popular. The article pays all the attention on showing the complete process of the QFD applied in the real residence energy-saving design, via probing the QFD applying mechanism in the residence energy-saving design, studying the quality needs throughout the process of real estate development and analyzing quantitatively the relation between the residence energy-saving standard requirements and various stages of real estate development. Finally, the article submits a concrete and applicable proposal which will guide designers to get the satisfaction of the customer required quality. Oriented by market and guided by the standards, the final target of the paper is to fully guarantee energy conservation and applicability of the building since the initial stage and to achieve energy-saving building within the shortest R&D cycle possible.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: The Granger Causality Relationship between the Housing Price and the Land Price in China
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Housing Price; Granger causality; ADF test
Abstract: As a result of rapid economic growth and urbanization, demand for urban land and new dwellings have increased accordingly, leading to the sustained growth of housing prices. Housing price in China has been rising rapidly, which makes buying an own house a big burden for ordinary people. To prevent rapid rising of housing price, government has initiated many policies and regulations which proved not so effective as estimated in controlling housing price. This paper intends to describe the relationship between land use policy and residential housing market. The interactions between housing price and land price are ermined, based on Granger causality analysis. Augmented Dicky-Fuller (ADF) test is used to study the integration of these time series and the cointegration relations between housing price and land price. Then the author analyzes the Granger causality relation betweens housing price and land price. The result of this paper will help policy maker in China to make correct land regulations.

Abstract: Based on the summary of the existing research, we are going to explain the external connotations of sports tourism using the theory of externality We will analyze the external performance of sports tourism both economically and uneconomically We've noticed that the special attributes of sports tourism resources and products have asserted special claims to the management system of sports tourism, thus, we'll explain it in specific. We're aiming at promoting sports tourism's separating government administration from enterprise management system and the effect of comprehensive management, and improving the multidimensional and multi-level network management system to improve response.
