Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Design for Construction Safety: a Literature Review
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Construction site safety; Design; Risk Management; Literature Review
Abstract: The rapid growth of Chinese economy calls for massive development of infrastructures and assets. While it brings opportunities to construction industry, the poor safety performance arouses increasing attentions.Construction is one of the most hazardous industries in terms of the aggregate number of fatalities. Improving the safety of construction site through design practices upstream of the construction phase is the objective of the design for construction safety (DfCS) concept. Design professionals traditionally focus on the safety of the end user of the buildings or other facilities rather than those who will construct it. The constructor is positioned to promote safe work conditions and enable safe work practices. Globally, the DfCS concept has gained momentum as an intervention to improve construction site safety and an extensive list of related articles can be found in top journals. This paper is a review of some of the literatures related to the concept. Main contents of this paper are: definition of the concept, harriers and opportunities of application, relationship between design and construction site safety, existed design suggestion and tools, methods of foregoing investigations. Two typical examples of DfCS researches are enumerated in the end.

Article Title: VALUE OF ICT MOBILE MEANS IN AN INCREASE OF COMPANY COMPETITIVENESS
Source Title: AEBD '09: PROCEEDINGS OF THE WORLD MULTICONFERENCE ON APPLIED ECONOMICS, BUSINESS AND DEVELOPMENT

Conference Title: World Multiconference on Applied Economics, Business and Development (AEBD '09)
Author Keywords: mobility; strategy; mobile commerce (m-commerce); mobile business (m-business); time management; mobile technology
Abstract: The contemporary development of the mobile information and communication technologies offers many opportunities for their massive employment in the field of information support of the businesses and its systemic processes. We are the witnesses of the transition from wire to wireless communication and from fixed localization of communication centres to the localization undetermined by a place, time or a person. In the field of information systems, distributed approaches and systems, recently based mostly on the service-oriented architecture (SOA), have gained a great deal of ground. The proposals and implementations of wide information systems are nevertheless fortified with the mobile elements and the mobile technologies usually very modestly and not in the systemic way but partially, although their strategic importance may act the role of a big boost in the play of subject's competitiveness.

Article Title: The Trade Liberalization in Romanian Economy
Source Title: AEBD '09: PROCEEDINGS OF THE WORLD MULTICONFERENCE ON APPLIED ECONOMICS, BUSINESS AND DEVELOPMENT
Book Series Title: Recent Advances in Computer Engineering
Conference Title: World Multiconference on Applied Economics, Business and Development (AEBD '09)
Author Keywords: commercial politics; economic growth; customs fee; non-tarrifary barriers; European integration
Abstract: The concept of free exchange was not completely new to Romania at the time of its adheration due to its having signed several regional agreements of free commerce, the importance of the phenomenon entailed by its inclusion as a full right member on to the unique market would result in an economic endeavour considerably bigger than the previous regional agreements. After the adheration to the European Union, Romania has considerably changed its views in commercial politics, thus becoming an adhering member to a huge community market with neo-liberal views.

Authors: Rahaman, NAA; Jaapar, A; Mustapha, AA; Yusuwan, NM
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Rahaman, Nur Adilla Abd; Jaapar, Aini; Mustapha, Arniatul Aiza; Yusuwan, Norazian Mohamad
Article Title: Application of Value Management in Interior Design Projects in Kiang Valley, Malaysia
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Value Manageme; Interior Design; Projects; Project Brief; Quantitative Study
Abstract: The research focuses on the extent of value management practice application in the construction industry specifically during the interior design briefing stage. The objective of this research paper is to identify the level of involvement by the interior design firms in this stage of a project. The problems encountered by them during the briefing stage are also recognized. Lastly, the impact of value management implementation is examined among the interior design job in Malaysia. Questionnaires were distributed to interior design firms operating in Klang Valley, Malaysia. The questionnaires consisted questions in regards to the level of the firms approach in the value management practice. From the research, it is found that value management is a good approach in increasing the efficiency of the interior design project and can offer value for money. However, the respondents agreed that the value management practice should be implemented in the early stage of project cycle. Lastly, respondents also express that the value management practice will only be successful if cooperation amongst the industry's players. Based on the findings it is recommended that value management should be stressed up in an early stage of project cycle and cooperation between project team is essential in order to achieve value for money

Article Title: Supply Chain Solutions for Manufacturing Companies
Source Title: AEBD '09: PROCEEDINGS OF THE WORLD MULTICONFERENCE ON APPLIED ECONOMICS, BUSINESS AND DEVELOPMENT
Book Series Title: Recent Advances in Computer Engineering
Conference Title: World Multiconference on Applied Economics, Business and Development (AEBD '09)
Author Keywords: Supply Chain Management; Supply Chain Integration; Supply Chain Management Strategy
Abstract: Supply Chain Management (SCM) is the process of planning, implementing and controlling the operations of the supply chain as efficiently as possible. The purpose of this paper is to review a sample of the literature relating to the integration and implementation of supply chain management practices from a strategic viewpoint. This literature is examined from three perspectives; SCM system background, supply chain integration and strategy, planning and implementation of SCM in developing the companies. The problems were divided into three part which are quality data for proper forecasting; attitude of supply chain members toward technology; and relationship between the supply chain members. Beside that, trust is the main point in the SCM integration, which are relating to the human element. By implementing SCM efficiently, the manufacturing companies can achieve their goal.

Article Title: Reflection on sustainable development of China's real estate industry under the financial crisis context
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Real estate industry; Sustainable development; Real estate enterprise; Real estate finance
Abstract: People became more and more concerned with the sustainable development of the real estate industry, after the sub-loan crisis caused by real estate industry evolved into the global financial crisis. The amount of vacant housing increasing, the supply structure of real estate market unbalancing, volume shrinking, the fund shortage of real estate enterprise and bad debts of real estate loans rising, were the current problems in China's real estate. The predicament in real estate industry of China was mainly caused by the following reasons. Firstly, the real estate industry was lacking in systematic long-term plan from the state. Secondly, the real estate enterprises were over-optimistic about the market. Finally, non-rational consumption of housing buyers, over-lending of banks and the real estate speculation had increased the volatility of the real estate market. In order to achieve sustainable development of real estate industry, in the near future, the government needs to set up regulated real estate market and real estate finance market, simultaneously guarantee the smooth operation of these two markets; Real estate enterprises and real estate agencies need to operate in accordance with the law; Commercial Banks need to control the loan scale and loan risk.

Authors: Wang, HB; Qin, J; Hu, YH; Dong, L
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Wang, H. B.; Qin, J.; Hu, Y. H.; Dong, L.
Article Title: Optimization of tree planning between buildings of residential area: the case of Shanghai, China
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Residential Area; Greening between houses; Tree planning; Model; Shanghai
Abstract: The competition of modern real estate is the competition of residential environment quality to some extent. The comfortable and graceful green surrounding is pursued on the one hand,and on the other hand, it is required of good day-lighting and ventilation. Scientific tree planning is very important for housing day-lighting. Only tree layout optimization can bring good day-lighting, having the least contradiction among day lighting, beauty and ecology benefits. So it concerned to the technology of tree planning in very limited living space. Tree planning is the key and difficulty between buildings of residential area and to realize quantitative planning is necessary. By the ways of air-chip assistance, investigation and computer simulation technology, we built the optimization models between tree and buildings. We made computer simulation analysis for four common models of greening layout between buildings of residential area in Shanghai. The result was that green space width, road width and road location were the main factors of tree type planning. Middle tree can be applied in most layout models; large delicious tree in all models but 'Road center'; stalwart delicious tree of similar cone type and similar elliptic type in model 'Road near south building'. The high-rise was more suitably planted with large trees. Of ever-green tree, the middle and small tree could be applied generally, but the large and stalwart would not.

Book Editors: Zhang, MH; Yu, Y
Article Title: Macroeconomics Models with Linear System Theory
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: Input-Output Analysis; linear systems; matrix eigenvalue; Positive Eigenvector Method
Abstract: Based on the idea of Input-Output Analysis, a country's national economy can be considered as a complex system that could be described by mathematical and linear models. Then the linear economy models could be analyzed using linear system theory and Positive Eigenvector Method put forward by Luogeng Hua. For closed and dynamic economic system, the result is that it is not stable but active. For a kind of open linear economic system, it is active if and only if the input coefficient should be bigger than a limit. However active economic system does not mean increasing. To ensure the economic system increasing, two conditions are necessary and sufficient. One is the input coefficient should be bigger than another limit, and the other condition is that it should be linear correlation between the original input vector and the positive eigenvector of the direct consumption coefficient matrix.

Article Title: EXTERNAL STRATEGIC REFERENCE POINTS WITH RASCH MODEL
Source Title: AEBD '09: PROCEEDINGS OF THE WORLD MULTICONFERENCE ON APPLIED ECONOMICS, BUSINESS AND DEVELOPMENT
Book Series Title: Recent Advances in Computer Engineering
Conference Title: World Multiconference on Applied Economics, Business and Development (AEBD '09)
Author Keywords: Rasch; strategic reference points; strategic orientation
Abstract: The objective of this work is to identify the external strategic reference points. The Rasch Model is used to prepare the profile that allows the external strategic reference points to be identified. The items have been assessed by a sample of managers of firms in Canary Islands (Spain), which is dominated by the small and medium sized enterprises in the service sector. The results show that the principal references that guide the firm's strategic processes include customers and current competitors as external strategic reference points.

Article Title: A Visual Nd Building Information Model to Improve Construction Collaboration
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: nD modeling; Construction design; Construction management; Construction collaboration
Abstract: Efficient construction collaboration among all participants, objectives and construction lifecycle is performance. development construction crucial to improve construction This paper aims to investigate the of an nD enabled collaborative environment, which provides a collaborative information sharing and management platform for construction design and construction management. There is a growing realization that poor information management is the biggest barrier that obstructs construction collaboration. The nD modeling, which is an extension of the building information model, incorporates multi-aspects of design information required at each stage of the lifecycle of a building facility, fosters the integration of construction project information and the collaboration of construction. This paper introduces the principles and technology support of nD modeling, analyzes the challenges that traditional construction design and construction management facing, proposes an nD enabled collaborative environment, and explains how the construction design and management collaboration can be achieved though the nD modeling.

Authors: Zhang, L; Wang, YW; Yao, B; Yan, H
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Zhang, L.; Wang, Y. W.; Yao, B.; Yan, H.
Article Title: Research Assessment Index System of Energy-saving Technology Optimization in Green Building Design in Heilongjiang Province
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Energy-saving technology; Green building; Building design; Assessment index system
Abstract: In recent years, the completion of the construction area nearly two billion square meters every year in China's urban, of which 12-14 million square meters are urban and rural residential. Within residential buildings, more than 95% are high-energy construction. Compared to developed countries of the same latitude and similar climate, China's unit gross floor area uses three times energy consumed by heating. With the increasing population and the rising living standards of people, energy consumption of civilian construction will increase further. It is predicted that China's building energy consumption will rapidly increase from the current of 27.6% to 33%, and the issue of building energy consumption is extremely urgent. So green building is the fundamental way to completely improve living environment in our country, and to reduce building heating and refrigeration energy consumption, and to solve the problem that energy issue confine china's economic development 'bottlenecks'. And green building design technologies are the basic technical means of realizing energy-saving building, and they are also an important way to enhance the Heilongjiang province construction industry technology level and market competitiveness and as well as the national, and it is also the important aspect to enhance the construction economy and the GDP total growth contribution rate in Heilongjiang province. Based on the analysis of development status and trends of green building design technologies, through in-depth and meticulous analysis and listing systematically of green building design technology system, meanwhile, based on the comprehensive assessment on the technical factor, economic factor and the local environment adaptability of each green building design technology, and then combining with the practical situation of construction industry and local climatic conditions in Heilongjiang Province, this paper built the green building design technology optimization assessment index system which is suitable for promoting and applying in Heilongjiang, and after intensive study of technology criteria selection system of green building design, the scientific management mechanism of green building design technology can be established, and it can provide technical support for the great-leap-forward development of green building design in Heilongjiang Province.

Authors: Zhang, LS; Dong, YY; Zhu, TZ; Meng, DG
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Zhang, L. S.; Dong, Y. Y.; Zhu, T. Z.; Meng, D. G.
Article Title: Study on the Status and the Countermeasures of Brain Drain in Construction Enterprises
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: construction enterprises; brain drain; measures
Abstract: As society progresses, human resources management will be facing more challenges, and a knowledge - based senior managerial and technical talent scarcity is the most challenging. The flow of talents is normal for construction enterprise. It will definitely hinder the normal operation of enterprises if the flow of talents, particularly advanced talents drain, is too frequent. We need to seriously think not only how to use the talents, but also how to retain the talents. According to the long-term goal of the enterprise, we should seriously study the enterprise human resources planning, establish the effective incentive mechanism, form the well enlightened corporate culture, and always keep the enterprise with vitality and competitiveness. Based on the market research and the questionnaire survey, the influence of talents drain to construction enterprise is discussed. Talents drain will increase labor costs, cause loss of intangible assets, affect the stability of the teamwork, and lose enterprise development opportunities. The reason of construction enterprises talents drain is summarized. The management model of enterprise is outdated. The employee's career planning is unreasonable. Enterprise do not form the scientific talents assessment mechanism. Some employees leave the enterprise following the key figure. Some employees leave the enterprise because of salary and children' education. Finally, some specific measures avoiding talents drain are proposed for construction enterprise. We should establish a high quality leadership team, strengthen enterprises culture, implement kindly management, establish multi-unit salary system, establish competitive growth career planning, and carry out recruitment work successfully, etc.

Authors: Zhou, H; Xia, Y; Yao, LL
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Zhou Hong; Xia Ying; Yao Linli
Article Title: Housing Demand and Sustainable Release of China's Real Estate under International Financial Crisis-A case of Xiamen city
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Financial crisis; Real estate; Housing demand; Sustainable release
Abstract: Sub-prime loan of America results in global economic crisis. The real state economy of China is confronted with a serious tribulation. Housing demand refers to the need of buying a new house and the flexibility is less than 1 under the premise that the consumer could meet a certain level of economic payment capacity. In this paper, depth interviews, questionnaires and other methods were taken to the quantity research of Xiamen real estate rigid demand. The study shows that Xiamen's real estate market commonly with our whole country's has a potential demand, yet the rigid demand is obviously deficient under the current market price. Real estate agent needs to transform the potential demand into the rigid demand to digest stock in trade. This paper provides a specific number of reference to China's real estate rigid demand, a foundation for the macro-policy choices and real estate business decisions.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Research on Price System of Building Construction Product Based on Emergy Analysis
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Emergy analysis; Building construction; Ecological price
Abstract: The life cycle of building relates integrate problem on environment, economy and society. That is, the building supply the housing condition at the same time it result in ecologic environment and society puzzles. But the existing price index system can not calculate the real cost and value of the building product, even threat the sustainable development of economy and society. The method of Emergy found on biology physical quantity is a kind of system analysis method which takes the energy as the core. The life cycle ecological price of building construction product is analyzed in the paper on the index and structure. So the first, the new material, product and technology prices should be measured. The second, the green housing and building price also should be researched during the life cycle. The third, the cost which we regenerate the existing building to saving energy should be calculated. The paper is the revolution of building price method according to the ecology. Moreover it will drive the downright revolution of building construction project and other construction project.

Authors: Ben-Tal, A; Do Chung, B; Mandala, SR; Yao, T
Author Full Names: Ben-Tal, Aharon; Do Chung, Byung; Mandala, Supreet Reddy; Yao, Tao
Article Title: Robust optimization for emergency logistics planning: Risk mitigation in humanitarian relief supply chains
Author Keywords: Robust optimization; Dynamic traffic assignment; Demand uncertainty; Emergency logistics
Abstract: This paper proposes a methodology to generate a robust logistics plan that can mitigate demand uncertainty in humanitarian relief supply chains. More specifically, we apply robust optimization (RO) for dynamically assigning emergency response and evacuation traffic flow problems with time dependent demand uncertainty. This paper studies a Cell Transmission Model (CTM) based system optimum dynamic traffic assignment model. We adopt a min-max criterion and apply an extension of the RO method adjusted to dynamic optimization problems, an affinely adjustable robust counterpart (AARC) approach. Simulation experiments show that the AARC solution provides excellent results when compared to deterministic solution and sampling based stochastic programming solution. General insights of RO and transportation that may have wider applicability in humanitarian relief supply chains are provided. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: A multiobjective chance constrained programming model for supplier selection under uncertainty
Author Keywords: Stochastic programming; Outsourcing risks; Goal programming; Linearization
Abstract: Risk management is an inherent part of supplier selection. While companies are enjoying the benefits of outsourcing, risks brought by this practice should be taken into account in the process of decision making. This paper presents a multiobjective stochastic sequential supplier allocation model to help in supplier selection under uncertainty. Demand for products, capacities at suppliers as well as transportation and other variable costs are the main sources of uncertainty and are modeled using probability distributions. Disruptions are exogenous events and the model provides proactive mitigation strategies against disruptions by assigning backup suppliers who can be used in case of a default at a primary supplier. When there is no disruption, the model's solution is an optimal supplier order assignment, considering operational risks. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Friesz, TL; Lee, I; Lin, CC
Author Full Names: Friesz, Terry L.; Lee, Ilsoo; Lin, Cheng-Chang
Article Title: Competition and disruption in a dynamic urban supply chain
Author Keywords: Dynamic supply chains; Supply chain networks; Urban supply chains; City logistics; Disruptions; Differential variational inequalities
Abstract: Rapid changes and complexities in business environments have stressed the importance of interactions between partners and competitors, leading supply chains to become the most important element of contemporary business environments. There is a concomitant need for foresight in describing supply chain performance in all operating environments, including those involving punctuated disruptions. Furthermore, the urban metropolis is now widely recognized to be an environment which is especially vulnerable to supply chain disruptions and for which integrated supply chain decisions can produce very substantial net benefits. Accordingly, this paper presents a dynamic supply chain network model formulated as a differential variational inequality; the model is fashioned to allow consideration of supply chain disruption threats to producers, freight carriers, and retail enterprises. The DVI is solved using a fixed-point algorithm, and a simple numerical example, introduced to illustrate how the impacts of supply chain disruptions may be quantified, is presented. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Author Full Names: Lei, Ting L.; Church, Richard L.
Article Title: Locating short-term empty-container storage facilities to support port operations: A user optimal approach
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Empty container logistics; Facility location; Container transport; Marine port operations; Integer linear programming
Abstract: This paper presents three strategic-level models for locating away-from-port storage yards for empty shipping containers. The main objective is to reduce the mileage involved in repositioning empty containers. The models presented attempt to capture the greedy behavior of individual trucking companies and provide for the first time a user optimal modeling approach for empty container management. An application to the port complexes of Los Angeles and Long Beach demonstrates that savings associated with storage yards could be easily overestimated when neglecting the perspective of the individual trucking companies. Strategies to encourage system optimal behavior are proposed. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Smith, LD; Nauss, RM; Mattfeld, DC; Li, J; Ehmke, JF; Reindl, M
Author Full Names: Smith, L. Douglas; Nauss, Robert M.; Mattfeld, Dirk Christian; Li, Jian; Ehmke, Jan F.; Reindl, M.
Article Title: Scheduling operations at system choke points with sequence-dependent delays and processing times
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Heuristic; Scheduling; MIP; Transportation service facilities; Simulation
Abstract: Transportation service facilities often form system choke points with service rendered to entities from multiple queues that require staging for processing. With an MIP model that accommodates sequence-dependent setup times and processing times, we demonstrate how scheduling can be improved relative to simple rules that impose equity (such as FIFO) or efficiency (such as fastest processing time). Using an efficient heuristic scheduler for problems of this type, we then demonstrate, with simulation, the benefits that can occur from employing the refined scheduling procedure at a series of choke points in a transportation system subject to highly variable seasonal traffic. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Combined ship allocation, routing and freight assignment in tramp shipping
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Genetic algorithm; Ship routing; Tramp shipping; Less-than-shipload; Freight assignment
Keywords Plus: GENETIC ALGORITHM; TIME; NETWORK; PICKUP; VRP
Abstract: In this paper, we consider the ship routing problem of tramp shipping (SRPTP) and propose a combined mathematical model that simultaneously takes into account the ship allocation, freight assignment and ship routing problems of SRPTP. To solve this problem, we investigate the practical operational issues of SRPTP and develop a genetic algorithm. The empirical studies demonstrate the applicability of the proposed solution scheme for solving real-world problems that are beyond the reach of a widely used commercial optimization package. The technical, computational, practical and calibration issues involved in this unique tramp shipping problem are discussed in detail in this paper. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: A dynamic programming algorithm based on expected revenue approximation for the network revenue management problem
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Conference Title: 13th World Conference of the Air-Transport-Research-Society (ATRS)
Conference Sponsor: Air Transport Res Soc (ATRS)
Author Keywords: Revenue management; Seat control policy; Dynamic programming
Keywords Plus: AIRLINE SEAT ALLOCATION; YIELD MANAGEMENT; BID PRICES; MODEL
Abstract: Since American Airlines successfully applied revenue management (RM) to raise its revenue, RM has become a common technique in the airline industry. Due to the current hub-and-spoke operation of the airline industry, the focus of RM research has shifted from the traditional single-leg problem to the network-type problem. The mainstream approaches, bid price and virtual nesting, are faced with some limitations such as inaccuracy due to their suboptimal nature and operation interruption caused by the required updates. This study developed an algorithm to generate a seat control policy by approximating the expected revenue function in a dynamic programming (DP) model. In order to deal with the issue of dimensionality for the DP model in a network context, this study used a suitable parameterized function and a sampling concept to achieve the approximation. In the numerical experiment, the objective function value of the developed algorithm was very close to the one achieved by the optimal control. We believe that this approach can serve as an alternative to the current mainstream approaches for the network RM problem for airlines and will provide an inspiring concept for other types of multi-resource RM problems. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Morning commute problem considering route choice, user heterogeneity and alternative system optima
Author Keywords: Bottleneck model; Congestion pricing; Alternative system optima; User heterogeneity; Social inequity
Keywords Plus: DEPENDENT EQUILIBRIUM DISTRIBUTION; CONGESTION TOLLS; DEPARTURE TIME; EXISTENCE; MULTICLASS; UNIQUENESS; ARRIVALS
Abstract: This paper extends the bottleneck model to study congestion behavior of morning commute and its implications to transportation economics. The proposed model considers simultaneous route and departure time choices of heterogenous users who are distinguished by their valuation of travel time and punctual arrival. Moreover, two dynamic system optima are considered: one minimizes system cost in the unit of monetary value (i.e., the conventional system optimum, or SO) and the other minimizes system cost in the unit of travel time (i.e., the time-based SO, or TSO). Analytical solutions of no-toll equilibrium, SO and ISO are provided and the welfare effects of the corresponding dynamic congestion pricing options are examined, with and without route choice. The analyses suggest that TSO provides a Pareto-improving solution to the social inequity issue associated with SO. Although a TSO toll is generally discriminatory, anonymous TSO tolls do exist under certain circumstances. Unlike in the case with homogenous users, an SO toll generally alters users' route choices by tolling the poorer users off the more desirable road, which worsens social inequity. Numerical examples are presented to verify analytical results. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Productivity of airline carriers and its relation to deregulation, privatisation and membership in strategic alliances
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Airline; Productivity; Deregulation; Alliance; Privatisation
Keywords Plus: UNITED-STATES; OPERATIONAL PERFORMANCE; INTERNATIONAL AIRLINES; FRONTIER ESTIMATION; EFFICIENCY; INDUSTRY; SCALE; OWNERSHIP; ECONOMIES; PRIVATE
Abstract: This study looks at how deregulation, privatisation and the formation of strategic alliances have affected the productivity of international airlines. We evaluate all three factors simultaneously and disaggregate the carriers operations into production and sales and allow for unobserved firm-level heterogeneity through random parameters. Estimations of stochastic frontier models reveal that on the aggregate level, deregulation increases productivity, membership in alliances has an ambiguous effect and state ownership has no significant effect. Disaggregating the carriers' operations confirms the productivity gains from deregulation, and that state ownership and alliances have contradictory effects. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Batley, R; Dargay, J; Wardman, M
Author Full Names: Batley, Richard; Dargay, Joyce; Wardman, Mark
Article Title: The impact of lateness and reliability on passenger rail demand
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Rail demand; Reliability; Journey time variability; Elasticity; Dynamic
Abstract: To date, forecasts of the demand impacts of lateness and reliability have been derived largely from individual-level models taken at a snapshot in time. The contribution of this paper is to develop a dynamic model of rail demand at the market-level, yielding short and long-run elasticities with respect to lateness. Whereas individual-level models have suggested a high valuation of lateness and reliability, our market-level models indicate a relatively mooted demand response. Reconciling these findings, we reason that., whilst rail travellers show considerable disdain for experiences of lateness, such experiences will not necessarily dissuade them from travelling by train. (c) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Li, ZC; Lam, WHK; Wong, SC; Fu, XW
Author Full Names: Li, Zhi-Chun; Lam, William H. K.; Wong, S. C.; Fu, Xiaowen
Article Title: Optimal route allocation in a liberalizing airline market
Author Keywords: Airline network; Route allocation; Air transport liberalization; Investment; 0-1 integer programming; Implicit enumeration
Keywords Plus: NETWORK DESIGN PROBLEM; FLIGHT FREQUENCIES; SPOKE NETWORKS; COMPETITION; AIRPORT; CAPACITY; INDUSTRY; CHOICE; MODEL; EQUILIBRIA
Abstract: Airlines often encounter two major problems in expanding their international networks: (1) restrictive Air Services Agreements (ASAs) governing airlines' commercial rights, and (2) slot / capacity constraints in foreign hub airports. Government interventions are needed to solve these problems, yet few quantitative models are available to guide the design of related public policies. This paper proposes a new model for optimizing the allocation of additional routes in a liberalizing airline market, in which airport capacity constraints are explicitly considered. The proposed model captures the interactions among three types of agents: (1) a regulator who aims to maximize social welfare by optimizing the allocation of additional routes to competing carriers; (2) airlines competing with flight frequency and airfare; and (3) passengers who minimize their own travel disutility (or equivalently maximize utility) given airlines' services and prices. In the proposed model, the passenger demand elasticity is also explicitly considered. The route allocation model is formulated as a 0-1 integer programming problem, and is solved by a heuristic implicit enumeration approach. The Korean - mainland China - Hong Kong airline market serves as model illustration. The effects of airport slot constraints are examined, and the revealed value (marginal welfare gain) of airport capacity expansion is also calculated, which can potentially serve as a benchmark indicator for the planning of airport investments. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Shively, TS; Kockelman, K; Damien, P
Author Full Names: Shively, Thomas S.; Kockelman, Kara; Damien, Paul
Article Title: A Bayesian semi-parametric model to estimate relationships between crash counts and roadway characteristics
Author Keywords: Forecasting; Poisson-gamma model; Markov chain Monte Carlo; Monotonicity constraints; Regression splines
Keywords Plus: TRAFFIC ACCIDENT OCCURRENCE; NEGATIVE BINOMIAL MODEL; ISOTONIC REGRESSION; POISSON
Abstract: This paper uses a semi-parametric Poisson-gamma model to estimate the relationships between crash counts and various roadway characteristics, including curvature, traffic levels, speed limit and surface width. A Bayesian nonparametric estimation procedure is employed for the model's link function, substantially reducing the risk of a mis-specified model. It is shown via simulation that little is lost in terms of estimation quality if the nonparametric estimation procedure is used when standard parametric assumptions (e.g., linear functional forms) are satisfied, but there is significant gain if the parametric assumptions are violated. It is also shown that imposing appropriate monotonicity constraints on the relationships provides better function estimates. Results suggest that key factors for explaining crash rate variability across roadways are the amount and density of traffic, presence and degree of a horizontal curve, and road classification. Issues related to count forecasting on individual roadway segments and out-of-sample validation measures also are discussed. (c) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Bravo, M; Briceño, L; Cominetti, R; Cortés, CE; Martínez, F
Author Full Names: Bravo, Mario; Briceno, Luis; Cominetti, Roberto; Cortes, Cristian E.; Martinez, Francisco
Article Title: An integrated behavioral model of the land-use and transport systems with network congestion and location externalities
Author Keywords: Extended network; Land-use; Transport; Equilibrium approach; Externalities; Fixed-point problem
Abstract: The agents' decisions, from their residential location to their members' trip choices through the network, are jointly analyzed as an integrated long term equilibrium in which the location, travel decisions, and route choices are represented by logit or entropy models. In this approach, consumers optimize their combined residence and transport options represented as paths in an extended network built by connecting the transport sub-network to a fictitious sub-network that represents land-use and transport demand options. We model a static land-use and transport equilibrium by considering road congestion and location externalities. The latter include trip destination choices based on land-use attractions, as well as endogenous neighborhood characteristics that determine residential choices and segregation phenomena. The model can deal with heterogeneous populations and locations as well as multiple trip purposes, though it assumes only private transport modes. In a previous paper we studied the case with road congestion externalities only, characterizing equilibria by a strictly convex and coercive unconstrained minimization problem. This characterization fails for more general externalities, so we restate the model as a fixed-point problem, establishing the existence of equilibria, providing sufficient conditions for its uniqueness and for the convergence of a fixed-point iteration. A small numerical example is used to illustrate the model. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Nishimura, E; Imai, A; Janssens, GK; Papadimitriou, S
Author Full Names: Nishimura, Etsuko; Imai, Akio; Janssens, Gerrit K.; Papadimitriou, Stratos
Article Title: Container storage and transshipment marine terminals
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Transshipment containers; Container storage; Mega-containerships; Mathematical programming
Abstract: This study addresses the storage arrangement of transshipment containers on a container yard, in order to carry Out efficiently the ship handling operations at a terminal where mega-containerships call. An optimization model is specified to investigate the now of containers from the mega-containership to feeder ships using intermediate storage at the yard. A heuristic based on the lagrangian relaxation is formulated. The quality of the heuristic approach is tested in a number of experiments. In the experiments, various Situations are analyzed with respect to mega-containership arrival rates, some strategies for stack arrangements and terminal layouts. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Criticism of three-phase traffic theory
Author Keywords: Traffic breakdowns and congestion; Three-phase traffic theory; General pattern; Synchronized flow; Pinch effect; Wide scattering
Keywords Plus: EXPERIMENTAL FEATURES; PHASE-TRANSITIONS; MODEL; SIMULATION; STATES; FLOW; DERIVATION; WAVES; JAMS
Abstract: After introducing the history and main points of three-phase traffic theory, we continue with a critical discussion based on its theoretical features and empirical traffic data. Our data originate from the German freeway A5 close to Frankfurt, i.e. from the same freeway section that has been the basis for the development of three-phase traffic theory. Despite of this, we end up with partially different interpretations of the observations. In particular, we highlight findings that are inconsistent with three-phase traffic theory and facts that question the concept of a general pattern of congested traffic flow. Finally, we discuss some open problems that call for the development of improved traffic models and further empirical studies. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Optimal rail-road container terminal locations on the European network
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Location; Terminals; Hub-and-spoke; Network; Intermodal; Transport
Keywords Plus: INTERACTING HUB FACILITIES; QUADRATIC INTEGER-PROGRAM; P-MEDIAN PROBLEM; AGGREGATION; TRANSPORTATION; SYSTEM; ERRORS
Abstract: The European transport policy has focused on sustainable transport solutions, among which intermodal transport is a key player. However, its efficiency is strongly dependent on the location of the container terminals. In this paper, a set of estimated potential locations is used as input for an iterative procedure based on the p-hub median problem that takes the variation in trans-shipment costs according to the number of trans-shipped containers into account. The final results are the optimal locations for European transfer terminals embedded in a hub-and-spoke network. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Author Full Names: Sajadieh, Mohsen S.; Jokar, Mohammad R. Akbari
Article Title: Optimizing shipment, ordering and pricing policies in a two-stage supply chain with price-sensitive demand
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Joint economic lot sizing; Vendor-buyer coordination; Shipment policy; Pricing policy
Keywords Plus: CONTROLLABLE LEAD-TIME; LOT-SIZE MODEL; INVENTORY MODELS; VENDOR; BUYER; DECISIONS; COORDINATION; SYSTEM; REDUCTION; PURCHASER
Abstract: In this paper we focus on a two-stage supply chain consisting of one vendor and one buyer. We develop an integrated production-inventory-marketing model to determine the relevant profit-maximizing decision variable values. The model proposed is based on the joint total profit of both the vendor and the buyer, and it finds out the optimal ordering, shipment and pricing policies. We are able to ascertain the optimal decision variable values employing an analytical solution procedure. The numerical evidence suggests that it is more beneficial for the buyer and the vendor to cooperate with each other when the demand is more price sensitive. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: De Borger, B; Dunkerley, F; Proost, S
Author Full Names: De Borger, Bruno; Dunkerley, Fay; Proost, Stef
Article Title: Capacity cost structure, welfare and cost recovery: Are transport infrastructures with high fixed costs a handicap?
Author Keywords: Capacity cost structure; Cost recovery; Transport investment
Abstract: In this paper, we consider a region that invests in infrastructure used by both local demand and through traffic. We then compare transport systems that have, for a given capacity, the same total infrastructure cost but vary in the proportion of fixed costs and variable capacity costs. We show that, compared to a benchmark infrastructure which has zero fixed costs, an infrastructure which has (ceteris paribus) a higher share of fixed costs leads to higher welfare for the regional government building it. Moreover, we find that, even for capacity characterized by very high shares of fixed costs, financing of infrastructure is generally not an important issue as long as regions are allowed to toll through traffic. Finally, we show that, compared to the benchmark technology without fixed costs, regions are more likely to make a particular transport investment if they can chose a technology with higher fixed costs. As a corollary. projects with a higher share of fixed costs do not necessarily require higher federal subsidies. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Author Full Names: Seliaman, M. E.; Ahmad, Ab Rahman
Article Title: A generalized algebraic model for optimizing inventory decisions in a multi-stage complex supply chain
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Supply chain integration; Production-inventory models; Without derivatives
Abstract: In this paper, we deal with more generalized inventory coordination mechanism in an n-stage, multi-customer, non-serial supply chain, where we extend and generalize pervious works that use algebraic methods to optimize this coordinated supply chain. We establish the recursive expressions for this multi-variable optimization problem. These expressions are used for the derivation of the optimal replenishment policy and the development of the solution algorithm. Further, we describe a simple procedure that can help in sharing the coordination cost benefits to induce all stages to adopt the inventory coordination mechanism. We provide a numerical example for illustrative purposes. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Martínez, F; Aguila, F; Hurtubia, R
Author Full Names: Martinez, Francisco; Aguila, Felipe; Hurtubia, Ricardo
Article Title: The constrained multinomial logit: A semi-compensatory choice model
Author Keywords: Discrete choice; Logit models; Constrained behavior; Consumer's utilities
Abstract: The traditional formulation of logit models applied to transport demand assumes a compensatory (indirect) utility function in which the consumers' strategy assumes a trade-off between attributes. Several authors have criticized this approach because it fails to recognize attribute thresholds in consumer behavior, or a more generic domain where such a compensatory strategy is contained, In this paper, a mixed strategy is proposed, which combines the compensatory strategy valid in the interior of the choice domain with cutoff factors that restrain choices to the domain edge. The proposed model combines the multinomial logit model with a binomial logit factor that represents soft cutoffs. This approach extends previous contributions in several ways and allows multiple dimensions for cutoff factors. In addition to considering individual behavior, it introduces system constraints Such as capacity and inter-agent interactions (choice externalities). This extension yields a non-linear problem, which is solved by analyzing the fixed point problem. Additionally, a set of evaluation tools, a social utility of the constrained problem, and a measure of the shadow price of each constraint, are proposed. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Framework Research of Project Management Information System Based on BIM
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Building information modeling; Project management information system; Application status; IFC
Abstract: There are a great deal of complicated, various information in the construction project lifecycle. However, it is to restrict increasing the management level and management efficiency in a large extent by the reason of information loss, obstructed/untimely information sharing and the widespread phenomenon of the information island. The successful implementation of engineering construction depends largely on the efficiency and effectiveness of the information exchange among the participants. This paper firstly describes the basic concepts, technical characteristics and its application status of building information modeling (BIM). Then it analyses the existence of its many defects in the traditional project management information system, and points out that the traditional PMIS is increasingly unable to meet the needs of modern project management. So this paper proposes the framework of project management information system based on BIM, gives the system functions of the framework, points out the implementation ideas of these functions, and establishes a certain basis for the further implementation of system functions.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: The Determination of Housing Price : an Explanation Frame Based on Theory of Quantity of Money
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Credit Support; housing price; theory of quantity of money
Abstract: Based on theory of quantity of money in Chinese housing market, the paper points out that housing price is mainly determined by the quantity of housing supply and the quantity of demand for money to buy housing in common. However, there are some slight deferences about the determination of housing price between a closed housing market and an open housing market. In a closed housing market, the housing price is mainly determined by the quantity of housing supply, the inhabitants' income and the commercial banks' credit support to housing consumption. In an open housing market, the housing price is mainly determined by the quantity of housing supply, the inhabitants' income, the housing-buyers' wealth outside the district and the commercial banks' credit support to housing consumption. The quantity of housing supply is mainly determined by the amount of land provided by local government in the long run, and is mainly determined by the real estate developers' behavior of housing supply in the short run. By nature, the rising of housing price is both a phenomenon of housing & money quantity and a result of four-agent interaction among local government, commercial banks, real estate developers and local or outside housing buyers.

Article Title: Study on the Application of Price Adjustment Formulae in House Building
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Price Ddjustment Formulae; Price Fluctuation; Contract Price
Abstract: The construction product is different from general merchandise with long production period, big scale and high cost, and contractor must quote price before the production begin. The general conditions of Standard Tender Documents for Construction, promulgated by 9 ministries of China, such as National Development and Reform Commission, Ministry of Housing and Urban-Rural Development, etc, in 2007, define two ways of contract price adjustments for price fluctuation, the formulae method and the cost information method. Using formulae to adjust contract price is an internationally accepted practice, but it's seldom used in house building in china. Based on the present situation of house building in china, the author compares the two methods, then discusses in detail the application of the price adjustment formulae, including the choice of adjustment factor, quantitative analysis of the fixed coefficient and adjustment frequency on the impact of contract price, application of linear programming method for determining weights, and gives some suggestions on contract signing.

Authors: Gao, G; Zhao, SK; Wang, TY; Taudes, A
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Gao, G.; Zhao, S. K.; Wang, T. Y.; Taudes, Alfred
Article Title: Research on Civil Trade Area Ecology Evolution Effective Mechanism Model
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Civil trade area ecology evolution model; Life cycle; Economy cycle; Civilization
Abstract: There are internal rules during the formation and evolution of civil trade area ecology system, which reflect extend and tendency of economy, market and people's lively level in one nation. At the same time, there are also some restrict factors. With the development of economy and scientific technology, new trade area occurs, which threatens the existing trade area, and shortens some life cycle. Firstly, this paper will discuss the effective mechanism of city on civil trade area ecology evolution. The factors such as population size, economy society and infrastructure will effect the change and evolution of trade area. And trade area is also an important carrier for the city development, which is also the main symbol of city prosperity. Secondly, the paper researches the effective mechanism of industry on civil trade area ecology evolution. We will analyze the industrial benefit of civil trade area. Industry character and structure will affect the evolution of trade area. And civil trade area also has some relationship with the travel industry and culture industry. Thirdly, the paper will argue about the mutual effective mechanism of civil trade area ecology evolution. Fourthly, we set up a model of civil trade area ecology evolution effective mechanism. We find there are three dimensions which will affect the trade area ecology evolution: outside environment, internal growth, and time. According to the relationship, we obtain the model for civil trade area ecology evolution effective mechanism model.

Article Title: Efficient Factor Returns Replication in China A-Share Market
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT ICPEM 2009, VOL 9: SOCIAL SCIENCE METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: factor; portfolio; returns; track; exposures
Abstract: We present alternative methods for constructing factor-mimicking portfolios in practice We illustrate how portfolios with a limited number of assets and relatively low turnover can be used to track pure factor returns These portfolios provide an effective instrument to support the practice of investment management We illustrate how they can be used to hedge out unintended factor exposures of a passive benchmark, thus facilitating the optimal management of beta exposure We illustrate how they can be used to hedge out unintended factor exposures of an active strategy, thus isolating pure alpha and facilitating the management of alternative sources of alpha

Article Title: Econometric Analysis of Services Trade and China's Economic Growth -Based on Cointegration Test and Error Correction Model
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT ICPEM 2009, VOL 9: SOCIAL SCIENCE METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: services trade; economic growth; Co-integration test; Error Correction Model(ECM)
Abstract: With the development of the international division of work, rapid growth of the service economy has become a notable feature of economic in the world today Based on the theoretical and empirical analysis, this paper explores the role of services trade to economic growth Firstly he paper states the situation of the service trade. Secondly, we use empirical models testing of the relationships between services trade and economic growth. Finally, according to the results, we put forward proposals to the development of Chinese services trade. The result shows that services trade accelerates our economic growth no matter in short term or long term, and that there is only one-way causal relationship between services trade and economic growth

Abstract: This article first introduces status quo of government performance evaluation and domestic market integration in China, then points out that evaluation system of government performance based on economic performance mainly counteracts with the formation of domestic market integration Under the existing evaluation system of government performance, there comes protectionism and market segmentation since protection can bring the benefit on short-term Based on the above analysis, some suggestions are given aiming at promoting the integration of domestic market from aspects of government performance evaluation system and its implementation

Article Title: Study on Applicability of Cost Plus and Price Cap Regulation Approaches in China's Public Utilities
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)

Author Keywords: cost plus regulation; price cap regulation; public utility; transitional economy
Abstract: As a price regulatory approach with high incentive effect, price cap approach was designed considering defects of cost plus approach and had relative successful application in public utilities of developed countries. For a long time, cost plus has been one of the main price regulatory approaches being universally applied in China's public utilities; however, this approach stimulates enterprises to increase cost and investment, departing from the original intention of regulation. Despite the practical basis for introduction of price cap regulation, analysis shows that characteristics of institutional environment in transitional economy. The choice of these two price regulatory approach is decided by institutional environment.

Article Title: Theoretic Research on China's Current Financial Risk Management and Thinking of Its Optimization Strategy
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: financial crisis; risk management; realistic predicament; optimization strategy
Abstract: As the explosion of global financial crisis caused by American subprime mortgage crisis is becoming fiercer and fiercer, how to understand and manage financial risks to effectively prevent and eliminate financial crisis and ensure the financial security of our country has become an important task we are confronted with. In this paper, debate relevant to financial risk management and its theoretical basis are examined, and the realistic predicament and optimization strategy of financial risk management are analyzed from the perspective of the practical situation of our country. The creative idea of this paper lies in that it searches for the theoretical basis and practical strategy of financial risk management from the perspective of scientific thoughts, and suggests that we should not deny the potential benefits of developing capital market, financial innovation and being part of global financial integration. The research findings of this paper will have great reference value to facilitating stable and sound development of our country's financial business.

Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6

Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: the owner; green construction management; evaluation; project cost
Abstract: From the point of view of project management, green construction is the common goal for all participants of the project, and it requires their joint efforts. But the role of the owner has always been neglected in the course of carrying out green construction. After discussing the role of the owner, the paper points out the necessity for the owner to carry out green construction management. Then, the paper focuses on how to do for the owner at different stage of the project. In the course of bidding, project cost is proposed to be used in evaluating green construction, which facilitates quantitative comparison of green construction of different tenders.

Article Title: NoiseTube: Measuring and mapping noise pollution with mobile phones
Book Series Title: Environmental Science and Engineering
Conference Title: 4th International ICSC Symposium on Information Technologies in Environmental Engineering
Conference Sponsor: ICSC
Author Keywords: Noise pollution; citizen science; participatory sensing; people-centric sensing; geo-localisation; tagging; mobile phones
Abstract: In this paper we present a new approach for the assessment of noise pollution involving the general public. The goal of this project is to turn GPS-equipped mobile phones into noise sensors that enable citizens to measure their personal exposure to noise in their everyday environment. Thus each user can contribute by sharing their geo-localised measurements and further personal annotation to produce a collective noise map.

Article Title: Games of Coalition and Network Formation: A Survey

Abstract: This paper presents some recent developments in the theory of coalition and network formation. For this purpose, a few major equilibrium concepts recently introduced to model the formation of coalition structures and networks among players are briefly reviewed and discussed. Article Title: Using the Combined Defining Base Quota to Formulate A Cost Plus Fee Contract
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Contracting; Cost plus contracts; Asymmetric information
Abstract: The principal-agent relationships are widely applied in various industries. In the construction field, the most important principal-agent relationship is represented by a contract between owner and contractor or other construction professionals. A new type of cost plus fee (CPF) contractsis proposed to deal with the asymmetric information between owner and contractor in establishing the target cost. Based on review the principles of combined defining base quota (CDBQ) contracting used in common business, the contract framework is suggested with objectives of promoting contractor to quote a price according to the actual project cost and be efficient in project delivery, as well as allocation cost risk between owner and contractor. Advantages of the contract provided are demonstrated by boththeoretical confirmation and numerical simulation. In this paper, a new type of CPF contract is provided with objectives of promoting contractor to quote price according to actual project cost and be efficient in project delivery, as well as allocation cost risk between owner and contractor.

Book Editors: Athanasiadis, IN; Mitkas, PA; Rizzoli, AE; Gomez, JM
Article Title: An interdisciplinary approach to resolving conflict in the water domain
Book Series Title: Environmental Science and Engineering
Conference Title: 4th International ICSC Symposium on Information Technologies in Environmental Engineering
Conference Sponsor: ICSC
Author Keywords: Conflict; Agent; Integrated Water Management; Integrated Sustainability Assessment; Agent Based Modeling; Extreme Programming
Abstract: Integrated Water Management (IWM) in line with the European Union Water Framework Directive (WFD) promotes a collaborative-oriented approach to tackle water management issues. This requires the participation of various government departments and stakeholder groups along with scientists and experts from different scientific disciplines. Conflict, arising from the diversity of perspectives, beliefs and benefits among those interest groups is a common characteristic of integrated water management. In order to benefit from stakeholder participations in supporting and accepting any results obtained in stakeholder meetings etc, the conflict of interests must be addressed. Examining the essence of the conflict, the Integrated Sustainability Assessment (ISA) is a form of knowledge co-production aiming at gathering and synthesizing diverse perceptions of persisting problems. ISA is a cyclical process of scoping, envisioning, experimenting and learning to provide the stakeholder with a deeper understanding of causalities behind the water issues. Following the visionary process of ISA, we particularly focus on agent based modeling as an essential method to understand and visualize the complexity of water resource management. Agent Based Models (ABM.) complements traditional analytic methods and is a useful approach to depict not only the roots of conflict, but also potential resolutions based on stakeholders viewpoints. Nevertheless, ABM and designing and implementing the computer applications, which are supposed to reflect the ideas shaped during the ISA process, is very challenging. There are few examples of computer models, if any, embedding multiple disciplines to capture the interactions among stakeholders related to water issues. As a result of these challenges, many developed models detach from the initial goals and cannot be used effectively to address the problem. We strive to address some of these challenges by recognizing the need for an analytical (conceptual) framework along with empirical evidence from case studies as well as utilizing appropriate methodologies and tools for the implementation phase. Respectively, first, we explore the role of the Agent Modeling Language (AML) to develop the conceptual model upon which the computer models should be built up. AML provides a rich set of modeling constructs for modeling applications that substantiates and/or shows characteristics of multi-agent systems such as a river basin with all its stakeholders. Second, we propose to apply eXtreme Programming (XP) methodology to implement agent-based models. XP is based on short-time software delivery providing the developers with the opportunity of fixing the applications' errors, and changing the direction of development in the early stages. We use an example to illustrate the process of developing an agent-based model and how to deal with the complications of converging different perspectives in the model.

Authors: Park, WH; Oh, JK; Paek, JH
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Park, W. H.; Oh, J. K.; Paek, J. H.
Article Title: Project Management of Owner-In-House to Maximize Owner Impact for Korean Urban Regeneration Project
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Owner Impact; priority management elements; project consulting management; Star City; urban regeneration
Abstract: Urban regeneration projects are becoming more common in Korea, and they include re-development, reconstruction, 'new towns' and city center regeneration. The slogan of Seoul is 'the city's competitiveness, the country's competitiveness' and Seoul has initiated many urban regeneration projects. Construction management (CM) and project management (PM) is frequently applied to these projects, but it tends to be limited in its ability to maximize owner impact. Therefore, this study suggested Project Consulting Management as a new method of PM model for owner-in house to maximize an owner's impact. The model focuses on consulting management of priority elements at each stage, and it was applied to an actual project: Star City. The owner's powerful involvement ensured that the project was secure, and also advanced the new project. Urban regeneration projects involve various ambiguous sources, so the proposed model cannot be defined as a process model, although it can significantly increase the effectiveness of similar future works. The model will require modifications and revisions based on additional research.

Book Editors: Perlovsky, L; Dionysiou, DD; Zadeh, LA; Kostic, MM; GonzalezConcepcion, C; Jaberg, H
Author Full Names: Rinnergschwentner, Wolfgang; Tappeiner, Gottfried; Walde, Janette
Article Title: Bayesian Estimation of Multivariate Stochastic Volatility Modeled by Wishart Processes
Source Title: AEBD '09: PROCEEDINGS OF THE WORLD MULTICONFERENCE ON APPLIED ECONOMICS, BUSINESS AND DEVELOPMENT
Book Series Title: Recent Advances in Computer Engineering
Conference Title: World Multiconference on Applied Economics, Business and Development (AEBD '09)
Author Keywords: Bayesian time series; Stochastic covariance; Time-varying correlation; MCMC; Wishart processes
Abstract: This paper picks up a model developed by Philipov and Glickman 2006 for modeling multivariate stochastic volatility via Wishart processes. The implementation and estimation of the parameters using Bayesian techniques is analyzed profoundly with a simulation study. Special focus is put on the estimates of the time-dependent covariance matrix. Employing Gibbs sampler in combination with Metropolis Hastings algorithm the estimation of the latent variables is feasible and appropriate with respect to statistical properties. Still further research is necessary, however the preliminary findings are very promising.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Song Xianglai; Zhang Hao; Feng Changchun
Article Title: Analysis On Optimized Distribution Mode of Added-Value of Housing Provident Funds
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Housing Provident Funds; Added-Value; Distribution Pattern; Optimization
Abstract: The institution of Housing Provident Funds was the core of public housing finance policies in China, which gave financing support to public housing funds depositors to solve their housing issues themselves. The added-value of housing provident funds was formed through the fund assets operation. There were problems in added-value nature definition, ownership, and three-distribution pattern at present. This paper based on definition of added-value's nature and ownership. Through analyzing the housing provident funds' operation data, we drew the conclusion that the present added-value distribution was inefficient. With added-value distribution principles, the short-term and long-term targets of housing provident funds development, we optimized the distribution pattern of added-value.

Article Title: Are Chinese House Prices Too High?
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: real estate; cost of owning; price-to-rent ratio; imputed-to-actual rent index
Abstract: In this paper, we discuss in which Chinese cities, if any, residential real estate has become overpriced. We assess residential property prices in 32 Chinese cities, following the methodology suggested in Himmelberg et al (2005) and calculate the 'user cost of owning' for China, based on relevant taxes and tax shields, housing depreciation, expected capital gains, the risk premium for owning and the risk-free rate. Partial equilibrium in the housing market implies that the user cost should not exceed the cost of renting. We find that a) using price-to-rent and price-to-income ratios is not always effective to property benchmark prices in China; b) while significant price increases have been observed, especially in 2007, a number of Chinese cities in our sample do not show current signs of overpricing c) some cities, including Shanghai, do seem to be overpriced.
