Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Measures on Technical Efficiency of Real Estate Industry in China: An Empirical Analysis Based on Three-stage DEA Model
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Real estate industry; Three-stage DEA model; Technical efficiency; Pure technical efficiency; Scale efficiency
Abstract: The paper measures the technical efficiency of real estate industry efficiency for 35 large and medium-sized cities in China with three-stage DEA model, and compares the technical efficiency contained environmental variables and statistical noise with the technical efficiency without the environmental variables and statistical noise. The results of the paper are as follows: First, the technical efficiency and the scale efficiency of China's real estate industry are low, while the pure technical efficiency is much well. Second, the technical efficiency of China real estate industry is influenced by GDP, population, square and the number of corporate of real estate industry. This means that the differences of technical efficiency are owned to the environment variables under the same conditions. Finally, real estate industry in China is in the state of increasing return to scale, but the scale efficiency is low. The scale problem is the main obstacle for promotion of efficiency of China real estate industry. Therefore, in order to improve the technical efficiency of real estate industry efficiency in China, it must remain current high pure technical efficiency and promote the scale efficiency to realize sustainable development.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Promotion of the Traditional Strategy: Research on the Strategy of Large-Scale Project to Ensure Project Success
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Large-Scale Project Strategy; Project Success; Stakeholders
Abstract: The extent of achieving the strategic objectives is the key factor whether it can lead to the success of large-scale projects. For large-scale projects located in an integrated environment, a strategy of self-government should be stressed, instead of following the strategic model copied from the past. After comparing the business strategy, general project strategy and large-scale project strategy, the perspective that large-scale projects are flexible, innovative and systematic is proposed. Finally, this paper presents that only if the five key processes as follows be encircled closely, can we balance the interests of every project team and stakeholders, and achieve the maximization of value creation. That is, to reach a consensus of the project objectives among the project groups, customers and all management levels; to possess competent project manager and project team; to strengthen the construction of the project information system; to establish the mutual trust mechanism among the various participants; to ensure project success by innovation.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Reflection on the Engineering Consciousness Education in Universities Based on Graduation Designs of Civil Engineering Major
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Engineering consciousness; Higher education; Civil engineering; Practice
Abstract: The core of engineering consciousness is the consciousness of practice. The engineering consciousness, with rich contents and wide range, comprises the thoughts of integrating theory with practice, making concrete analysis of concrete conditions, aiming at solving engineering problems, which also comprises the sense and ability to proactively recognize the practical engineering procedure, background and condition. The training of the engineering consciousness enables people guide their action through the idea, knowledge and plan drawn from the reality, and makes the action be purposeful, guiding and predictable. The engineering consciousness training focuses on the thoughts cultivation with a clear thinking and strict logic. Due to the wide range of knowledge and many aspects of engineering practices, an obviously clear and strict thinking is needed in the teaching and expatiating, to guide students grasp the engineering thinking mode and form the application link of the engineering knowledge. Therefore, the engineering consciousness education is of very important meaning to the cultivation of the future civil engineers. On the basis of main issues and measures such as the importance of the engineering consciousness education, the phenomenon of the lack of engineering consciousness reflected in the graduation design of the civil engineering major, the cultivation of the engineering consciousness in the graduation design, this paper discusses and researches the cultivation of the engineering consciousness in the university education.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: A Study on the Government Behavior of Purchasing instead of Building Securing Housing
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Real estate market; Purchasing instead of building; Securing housing; The government behavior
Abstract: A new wave of market downturn has emerged in China's real estate market due to the mutative international situation. The government's practice of purchasing commercial residential houses used as securing housing not only can be considered as a significant measure of protecting people's livelihood, but also played a positive role for the stability of the real estate market. In order to achieve the multiple purposes, one securing housing policy-purchasing instead of building has been put forward by some local government. The function and impact of this policy have been analyzed in this paper. Based on the government intervention theory and some related theories in welfare economics, the development status of the real estate market was described under the influence of the financial crisis, and the issue was brought forward that purchasing instead of building was an effective policy in housing security. Secondly, an analysis of the public interest of society as a whole was made according to this policy, and difficulties in its implementation are indicated at the same time. Finally, from the perspective of financing channels, price, risk-sharing and market regulation, some specific assurance measures were provided.

Book Editors: Zhang, MH; Yu, Y
Article Title: Financial Restatements and Management Turnover
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT (ICPEM 2009), VOL 5: STATISTICS AND METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: financial Restatements; management turnover; incentive
Abstract: Because the reward contract is actually no perfect, managers maybe restate the financial reports in self-interest. Whether the governance structure of public companies can save the reputation and improve itself after the restatements is very important. We examine the relationship of the restatements and management turnover, using the 424 sample that restated the financial reports in 2005 and 917 that no-restated. And we collected the management turnover above-mentioned samples between 2006 and 2007. The conclusion is the manager turnover has positive correlation with restatements. It makes sense, because the governance structure of Chinese companies cans responses the restatements. More specifically, this paper offers the new studying views that our companies can punish their managers by firing them in the reason of restatements. This single also gives the managers incentive that do not restate easily. To decrease the cost of executive, the management turnover also is a substitute for supervision how the accounting system.

Article Title: Study on Mode of Providing the Aged at Home in the Perspective of Our Urban Community: History and Perspective of Providing the Aged in China
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT ICPEM 2009, VOL 9: SOCIAL SCIENCE METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: urban community; home-based pension; old-age pension form
Abstract: This article is based on the aging problem of Chinese population It compares the advantages and disadvantages of traditional pension form, give a detailed analysts of community home-based pensioner services in China from its beginning and in the current stage. Based on the individual need, It analyzes the community care service and home-based pension form Core of this article is explaining the advantage of home-based pension with community services in comparison with the traditional family pension form and with the pension in specialized pension institutions This home-based pension with community services is fit to the Chinese situation. Analysis of China's old-age home services in urban communities the issues involved and made a home suitable to China's national conditions endowment response 1. Enlarge the governmental fiscal support, create an development form with a strategy of multiple form and multi channel investment, all these should solve the financial problem of home-based pension with community services 2 Build up a team of community pension services with professional staff and voluntary supporter 3 Dynamic improvement to create a community pension service network. 4 Improving the evaluation mechanism of community services.

Article Title: Organizational Interface Management of Construction Projects under Asymmetric Information
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: construction project organization; information asymmetry; interface management
Abstract: With the rapid development of knowledge economy, the specialized departments of construction project is divided thinning, a construction project just need a large number of project participants who work together. Construction project involves lots of participants, so, the phenomenon of information asymmetry between two participants probably occurs. Taking owner and construction contractor as an example, this paper analyses the phenomenon of information asymmetry, and argues that the research on organizational interface under asymmetric information is feasible. From the organizational perspective, it finally provides several effective solutions, including: designing a reasonable contract; the application of a new procurement route; establishing a interface management information system; designing interfaces of functional departments of organizations correctly. As the interface management theory is still not perfect, this paper preliminarily explores the phenomenon of asymmetric information between different organizations. Policies and regulations, organizational culture and organizational system design also have an important impact on information asymmetry, which need further study.

Article Title: Study on the Mistakes of Urban Flowing Peddlers Management and Its Social Governance Paths
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT ICPEM 2009, VOL 9: SOCIAL SCIENCE METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: flowing peddlers; urban management; social participation
Abstract: It has been proved by the practices of urban management that lots of flowing peddlers without license in city can neither be prohibited nor clamped down It's a difficult problem which needs to be explored in depth on how to cope with the flowing peddlers more effectively The paper holds that Rime mistakes such as concepts or ways exist in the mode of urban management which affected the effectiveness of management. In order to fully reflect the human-centeredness and ensure the harmonious and steady development of social politics, the policy-makers should change their mind to carry out more rational methods, such as turning forbiddance to dispersion and seeking social governance ways On the one hand, the government should give an appropriate place for the flowing peddlers to operate openly, On the other hand, more management subjects should be Introduced into the urban-management field in order to broaden the social participations and eventually reach harmony between order and survival

Article Title: The Forecast Analysis of Developing Trend about Supply and Demand Factors for Beijing Real Estate Market in 2010
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Real estate market; Developing trend; Beijing
Abstract: Under the influence of international financial crisis and national economic stimulus package since 2008, Beijing land deal and house price present growth trend after Beijing real estate market appears bleak and gloom. It is the Overwhelming concern of government, real estate business and other people. It is full of suspense currently how Beijing real estate market changes because of these factors. This paper collects the nearly 10 year's data about Beijing real estate market and selects a number of index based on the Beijing real estate relationship between supply and demand. At the same time, we establish mathematical model for every index in order to predict the developing trend on Beijing real estate market. In the end, we analyze the result that is it will be up in Beijing real estate market with national adjusting policy and better situation of macroeconomy and give reference opinions to government and other people.

Article Title: Research on Contract Scheme of Urban Rail Transit Projects
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: urban rail transit projects; contract system; scheme; harmonize
Abstract: Positive contract management is necessary guarantee for engineering construction to go on smoothly. The characteristics of urban rail transit determine the complexity and uncertainty of its contract system. The contract scheme for Pre-project plays a very important role in the operation of project construction and management. It is an essential foundation for the future contract management, so the owner must pay enough attention to it. In combination with the construction management practice of the first subway line in Nanjing, the paper first analyzes the scheming gist of urban rail transit projects' contract and then points out how to harmonize the contract system. Based on this, the paper presents the contract system sketch map of urban rail transit projects according to all of the works from the work breakdown structure. The study result of this paper has an important guiding significance for the contract system scheme of urban rail transit projects in China.

Article Title: Promoting Social Equity by Adjusting Public Spending
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT ICPEM 2009, VOL 9: SOCIAL SCIENCE METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)

Author Keywords: public spending; economic growth; social equity
Abstract: Gross amount of public spending in China is huge, but the expenditure structure and regional distribution have been unbalanced since the 1994 fiscal decentralization reform, which results in disproportionate economic performance between urban and rural areas in China Because favorable investment opportunities rely on social infrastructure such as education and roads, thus these social infrastructures form the foundation of economic development With Improper public spending creating unfair economic opportunities for different areas, income distribution inequality has been enlarged which would weaken the social equity So, promoting social equity by adjusting public spending is a matter of great urgency.

Article Title: Study of Schedule Risk for Resource-Constrained Project Based on Improved PERT
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: schedule risk; PERT; schedule-resource optimization; 0-1 integer program; particle swarm
Abstract: Resource availability is limited in most situations.How to schedule under the condition of resource constraints is one of the most complicated subjects in project management field. Based on the views of risk management, this paper uses 0-1 integer programming techniques to establish the schedule-resource optimization model. At the first stage, it demonstrates the advantages of improved PERT model: firstly, the application of Moore method can improve the conventional distribution method of parameters of project activities; secondly, it improves the accuracy of the calculation by applying the restrictive portion of three point estimators method and the formula of expectation and variance for activity times; thirdly, it has considered the impact of non-critical line on key lines. At the second stage, this paper applies the particle swarm algorithm for solving 0-1 integer programming model by using the tool of MATLAB. Then, according to the project duration, the paper caculates the project schedule risk. Finally, a case study is used to demonstrate the model proposed.

Article Title: A single-level mixed integer linear formulation for a bi-level discrete network design problem
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Discrete network design problem; Bi-level programming; Transportation network; Multi-commodity flows
Keywords Plus: TRAFFIC ASSIGNMENT PROBLEM; EQUILIBRIUM; ALGORITHMS; MODELS; CONSTRAINTS; FLOWS
Abstract: Discrete network design problem (DNDP) is generally formulated as a bi-level programming. In this paper, a single-level mixed integer linear programming (SL-MILP) formulation for bi-level DNDP is presented. To cope with the dependency of node-link adjacency matrix on new links, travel time function is appropriately modified. The nonlinearity of the travel time function is also removed by means of a convex-combination based linear approximation which takes advantage of a unimodular structure. Two valid inequalities is developed which shorten computation time significantly. The validity of the proposed formulation is examined by two test problems. SL-MILP is able to provide optimal solution. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: How a fast lane may replace a congestion tollle
Author Keywords: Congestion; Tolling; Bottleneck; Scheduling; Fast lane
Abstract: This paper considers a congested bottleneck. A fast lane reserves a more than proportional share of capacity to a designated group of travelers. Travelers are otherwise identical and other travelers can use the reserved capacity when it would otherwise be idle. The paper shows that such a fast lane is always Pareto improving under Nash equilibrium in arrival times at the bottleneck and inelastic demand. It can replicate the arrival schedule and queueing outcomes of a toll that optimally charges a constant toll during part of the demand peak. Within some bounds, the fast lane scheme is still welfare improving when demand is elastic. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Performance evaluation of logistics systems under cost and reliability considerations
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Performance; Logistics system; Cost; Reliability; Algorithm
Abstract: In this article, both distribution cost and delivery reliability are integrated into performance index R-sb,R-d of logistics systems. The total distribution cost is not to exceed budget $b, the delivery reliability is the probability that the source distributes a demand d successfully to the destination. A major contribution is that we present a hybrid approach for straightforward computation of the R-sb,R-d. As of now, it is the only algorithm that can compute R-sb,R-d directly and practically. A real logistics system illustrates the proposed algorithm. In addition, computational results indicate that our algorithm outperforms existing algorithms. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Kamae, MS; Kamae, I; Cohen, JT; Neumann, PJ
Author Full Names: Kamae, Maki S.; Kamae, Isao; Cohen, Joshua T.; Neumann, Peter J.
Article Title: Regression analysis on the variation in efficiency frontiers for prevention stage of HIV/AIDS
Conference Title: 14th Annual Meeting of the International -Society-for-Pharmacoeconomics-and-Outcomes-Research
Conference Sponsor: Int Soc Pharmacoecon & Outcomes Res
Abstract: To investigate how the cost effectiveness of preventing HIV/AIDS varies across possible efficiency frontiers (EFs) by taking into account potentially relevant external factors, such as prevention stage, and how the EFs can be characterized using regression analysis given uncertainty of the QALY-cost estimates. We reviewed cost-effectiveness estimates for the prevention and treatment of HIV/AIDS published from 2002--2007 and catalogued in the Tufts Medical Center Cost-Effectiveness Analysis (CEA) Registry. We constructed efficiency frontier (EF) curves by plotting QALYs against costs, using methods used by the Institute for Quality and Efficiency in Health Care (IQWiG) in Germany. We stratified the QALY-cost ratios by prevention stage, country of study, and payer perspective, and estimated EF equations using log and square-root models. A total of 53 QALY-cost ratios were identified for HIV/AIDS in the Tufts CEA Registry. Plotted ratios stratified by prevention stage were visually grouped into a cluster consisting of primary/secondary prevention measures and a cluster consisting of tertiary measures. Correlation coefficients for each cluster were statistically significant. For each cluster, we derived two EF equations -- one based on the log model, and one based on the square-root model. Our findings indicate that stratification of HIV/AIDS interventions by prevention stage can yield distinct EFs, and that the correlation and regression analyses are useful for parametrically characterizing EF equations. Our study has certain limitations, such as the small number of included articles and the potential for study populations to be non-representative of countries of interest. Nonetheless, our approach could help develop a deeper appreciation of cost effectiveness beyond the deterministic approach developed by IQWiG.

Authors: Wu, D; Yin, YF; Yang, H
Author Full Names: Wu, Di; Yin, Yafeng; Yang, Hai
Article Title: The independence of volume-capacity ratio of private toll roads in general networks
Author Keywords: Private toll road; General networks; Volume-capacity ratio; Profit maximization and social welfare maximization
Abstract: In a general traffic network under some widely used assumptions, this paper proves that the level of service, represented by the volume-capacity (v/c) ratio, offered by a profit-maximizing private firm on a private toll road is independent of another competitor's choice of capacity and toll rate for another private toll road. The v/c ratio will be the same as the one provided by a centralized welfare-maximizing traffic authority. Moreover, the ratio remains the same even in a regulated market where the authority imposes a cap for the generalized travel cost on the private toll road. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Rapoport, A; Stein, WE; Mak, V; Zwick, R; Seale, DA
Author Full Names: Rapoport, Amnon; Stein, William E.; Mak, Vincent; Zwick, Rami; Seale, Darryl A.
Article Title: Endogenous arrivals in batch queues with constant or variable capacity
Author Keywords: Batch queueing; Game theory; Constant and variable capacity; Experiments
Abstract: We study batch queueing systems with continuous time, finite commuter populations, single server, and endogenously determined arrival times. Symmetric equilibrium solutions in mixed strategies are constructed and subsequently tested in two experiments that examine two different batch queueing models, one with a fixed server capacity, and the other with a variable server capacity. With experience in playing the stage queueing game repeatedly, experimental results from groups of 20 subjects support equilibrium play on the aggregate level when the server capacity is fixed and commonly known. When it is known to be variable, randomly changing from round to round, subjects diverge from equilibrium play and increase their individual payoffs substantially by significantly shortening their waiting time. Authors: Chang, DF; Jiang, ZH; Yan, W; He, JL
Author Full Names: Chang, Daofang; Jiang, Zuhua; Yan, Wei; He, Junliang
Article Title: Integrating berth allocation and quay crane assignments
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Berth allocation; Quay crane assignments; Objective programming; Rolling-horizon technique; Heuristic algorithm; Parallel genetic algorithm
Abstract: In this study, a dynamic allocation model using objective programming for berth allocation and quay crane assignments was preliminarily developed based on rolling-horizon approach. Afterwards, a hybrid parallel genetic algorithm (HPGA), which combined parallel genetic algorithm (PGA) and heuristic algorithm, was employed to resolve the proposed model. Furthermore, a simulation was conducted to evaluate the HPGA and to execute relevant gene repair techniques. Eventually, the numerical experiments on a specific container terminal were applied to illustrate the proposed models and algorithms. In so doing, the effectiveness of the proposed approach was verified. Crown Copyright (C) 2010 Published by Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: A Multi-Objective Goal Programming airport selection model for low-cost carriers' networks
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Airport selection; Point-to-point network; Multi-Objective Goal Programming
Keywords Plus: FULL-SERVICE CARRIERS; DECISION-MAKING; AIRLINE NETWORK; DESIGN
Abstract: This paper examines the practicability and validity of the Multi-Objective Goal Programming (MOGP) model in designing a point-to-point airline network. The MOGP mathematical model is used in this study to identify and select a best central airport and its connecting airports providing the best overall optimal performance. By using the proposed model in the selection process, one can expect to achieve the following objectives: (1) an airline network designed at less cost, (2) an airline network that generates more revenues, and (3) an airline network that serves more passengers. Route data from Taipei to the Southeast Asian region were selected for this experiment to validate the model's practicability. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Özkaya, E; Keskinocak, P; Joseph, VR; Weight, R
Author Full Names: Ozkaya, Evren; Keskinocak, Pinar; Joseph, V. Roshan; Weight, Ryan
Article Title: Estimating and benchmarking Less-than-Truckload market rates
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Less-than-Truckload; Market rate models; Pricing structure; Benchmarking
Abstract: In this paper, we present a regression-based methodology that can estimate the Less-than-Truckload (LTL) market rates with high reliability using an extensive database of historical shipments from continental United States. Our model successfully combines the quantitative data with qualitative market knowledge to produce better LTL market rate estimates which can be used in benchmarking studies allowing carriers and shippers to identify cost saving opportunities. We identify the main drivers of LTL pricing and reveal the effects of certain industry practices on the final market rates. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Treiber, M; Kesting, A; Helbing, D
Author Full Names: Treiber, Martin; Kesting, Arne; Helbing, Dirk
Article Title: Three-phase traffic theory and two-phase models with a fundamental diagram in the light of empirical stylized facts
Author Keywords: Second-order traffic models; Car-following models; Three-phase theory; Phase diagram; Synchronized traffic; Pinch effect
Keywords Plus: INDUCED PHASE-TRANSITIONS; FLOW; STATES; RESURRECTION; SIMULATION; DERIVATION; REQUIEM; WAVES; TIME
Abstract: Despite the availability of large empirical data sets and the long history of traffic modeling, the theory of traffic congestion on freeways is still highly controversial. In this contribution, we compare Kerner's three-phase traffic theory with the phase diagram approach for traffic models with a fundamental diagram. We discuss the inconsistent use of the term traffic phase and show that patterns demanded by three-phase traffic theory can be reproduced with simple two-phase models, if the model parameters are suitably specified and factors characteristic for real traffic flows are considered, such as effects of noise or heterogeneity or the actual freeway design (e g combinations of off- and on-ramps) Conversely. we demonstrate that models created to reproduce three-phase traffic theory create similar spatiotemporal traffic states and associated phase diagrams, no matter whether the parameters imply a fundamental diagram in equilibrium or non-unique flow-density relationships In conclusion, there are different ways of reproducing the empirical stylized facts of spatiotemporal congestion patterns summarized in this contribution, and it appears possible to overcome the controversy by a more precise definition of the scientific terms and a more careful comparison of models and data, considering effects of the measurement process and the right level of detail in the traffic model used. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved

Authors: Tan, ZJ; Yang, H; Guo, XL
Author Full Names: Tan, Zhijia; Yang, Hai; Guo, Xiaolei
Article Title: Properties of Pareto-efficient contracts and regulations for road franchising
Author Keywords: Private road; Road franchising; Pareto-efficiency; Regulation
Abstract: Private provision of public roads through build-operate-transfer (BOT) contracts is increasing around the world. This paper investigates the properties of Pareto-efficient BOT contracts using a bi-objective programming approach under perfect information. Under certain conventional assumptions, we find that for any Pareto-efficient BOT contract: (1) the concession period should be set to be the whole road life: (2) the volume-capacity ratio (or the road service quality) and the average social cost per trip are constantly equal to those at the social optimum whenever there are constant returns to scale in road construction. Extensions are made to the cases with increasing (decreasing) returns to scale in road construction. A variety of regulatory regimes are investigated to analyze the behavior of the profit-maximizing private firm, and efficient regulations, including demand and markup charge regulations, are elucidated for both the public and private sectors to achieve a predetermined Pareto-optimal outcome. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Santos, L; Coutinho-Rodrigues, J; Current, JR
Author Full Names: Santos, Luis; Coutinho-Rodrigues, Joao; Current, John R.
Article Title: An improved ant colony optimization based algorithm for the capacitated arc routing problem
Author Keywords: Capacitated arc routing; Ant colony optimization; Metaheuristics
Abstract: The capacitated arc routing problem is a well-studied problem in the Transportation/Logistics/OR literature. The problem consists of identifying the minimum cost routes required to service (e.g., pickup or deliver) demand located along the edges of a network. Unfortunately, the problem belongs to the set of NP-Hard problems: consequently. numerous heuristic and metaheuristic solution approaches have been developed to solve it. In this article. an ant colony optimization based metaheuristic is presented. Modifications are introduced for various components of the ant colony metaheuristics: specifically for those associated with the initial population, the ant decision rule and the local search procedure. The new metaheuristic was tested on seven standard test networks for the capacitated arc routing problem. The results demonstrate that the proposed approach performs extremely well vis-A-vis the state-of-the-art metaheuristics for the problem. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Stability and attraction domains of traffic equilibria in a day-to-day dynamical system formulation
Author Keywords: Traffic assignment; User equilibrium; Dynamical system; Attraction domain
Keywords Plus: TRANSPORTATION NETWORKS; STOCHASTIC EQUILIBRIUM; ASSIGNMENT; MODEL
Abstract: We formulate the traffic assignment problem from a dynamical system approach. All exogenous factors are considered to be constant over time and user equilibrium is being pursued through a day-to-day adjustment process. The traffic dynamics is represented by a recurrence function, which governs the system evolution over time. Equilibrium stability and attraction domain are then analyzed by studying the topological properties of the system evolution. Stability is important because unstable equilibrium is transient. Even for stable equilibrium, only points within its attraction domain are attracted to the equilibrium. We show that the attraction domain of a stable equilibrium is always open. Furthermore. its boundary is formed by trajectories towards unstable equilibria. Through an understanding of these properties, computation schemes can be devised to determine the ranges of the attraction domains, as demonstrated in this study. Once this is accomplished. a partition chart can be drawn on the state space where each part represents the attraction domain of an equilibrium point. We trust that charting the attraction domains of user equilibria, as presented in this paper, will open up innovative ways for transportation network management. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Methodological transferability in route choice modeling
Author Keywords: Model transferability; Path generation; Route choice modeling; Path Size Logit; Logit Kernel
Abstract: The search for the shortest path constitutes the common practice in actual traffic studies, as this simplistic route choice model enables the universal implementation of traffic assignment and simulation procedures to every network configuration. The literature illustrates the large efforts in trying to move forward from this simplistic approach, the limited attempts in modeling route choice behavior from revealed preference data, and the nonexistent endeavor in investigating the transferability of more realistic path generation techniques and route choice models. This paper introduces a test to analyze the transferability of path generation techniques that is based on a newly defined efficiency index for the evaluation of their cost-effectiveness. Then, equality of model estimates is tested to examine the transferability of route choice models, based on a methodology normally used in the estimation of models with mixed data (typically revealed and stated preference data) and on an existing transferability test statistic commonly used in mode choice modeling. Lastly, an experiment is presented to illustrate the implementation of the transferability tests, based on revealed preference data from two different case studies. Experiment results show that path generation techniques are totally transferable at the model specification level and partially transferable at the model parameter level, and that transferability is generally verified when parameters optimized for a larger network are successfully applied to a smaller network. Experiment results also show that not all route choice models are transferable at the model specification level, and none are transferable at the model parameter level. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Statistical estimation of railroad congestion delay
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Freight rail; Rail congestion; Statistical prediction; Econometric modeling
Abstract: This research identifies factors that are the major contributors to freight rail congestion using statistical analysis. Total train running time is predicted based on free running time predictors (horsepower per ton, track topography and slow orders) and congestion-related factors (meets, passes. overtakes, prior time periods' train counts, total train hours, train spacing variability, and train departure headway). Primary congestion predictive factors (meets, passes, overtakes) are consistently found to have the largest effect on congestion delay. The predictive equations are used to forecast average monthly train running time with a 4.6% mean absolute percent error. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: How to Reduce Unnecessary Noise in Targeted Networks
Source Title: NETWORKS, TOPOLOGY AND DYNAMICS:THEORY AND APPLICATIONS TO ECONOMICS AND SOCIAL SYSTEMS
Book Series Title: Lecture Notes in Economics and Mathematical Systems
Conference Title: NET Conference 2007
Conference Sponsor: Univ Studi Milano Bicocca, Dipt Metodi Quantitat Sci Econ Aziendali,Univ Cattol Milano, Dipt Discipl Mat, Finanza Mat Econ,Univ Studi Urbino, Ist Sci Econ
Keywords Plus: WAITING TIME PROBLEMS; TRIALS; SOONER; QUOTAS
Abstract: This work is a review of previous works on the stopping laws in networks. Among other results, we show a non combinatorial method to compute the stopping law, the existence of a minimal Markov chain without oversized information, the existence of a polynomial algorithm which projects the Markov chain onto the minimal Markov chain. Several applied examples are presented.

Article Title: The Dynamic Behaviour of Non-Homogeneous Single-Unireducible Markov and Semi-Markov Chains
Source Title: NETWORKS, TOPOLOGY AND DYNAMICS:THEORY AND APPLICATIONS TO ECONOMICS AND SOCIAL SYSTEMS
Book Series Title: Lecture Notes in Economics and Mathematical Systems
Conference Title: NET Conference 2007
Conference Sponsor: Univ Studi Milano Bicocca, Dipt Metodi Quantitat Sci Econ Aziendali,Univ Cattol Milano, Dipt Discipl Mat, Finanza Mat Econ,Univ Studi Urbino, Ist Sci Econ
Abstract: In this paper single-unireducible Markov and semi-Markov chains are defined and their dynamic behaviour is analysed. The main results concern the asymptotic study of these processes. In fact it is proved that the topological structure of single-unireducibility represents a sufficient condition that guarantees the absorption after a sufficiently long period in the absorbing class for both Markov and semi-Markov chains. The probabilistic results are based on graph theory using relations between the graphs and transition matrices.

Article Title: Towards a Novel Early Warning Service for State Agencies: A Feasibility Study
Book Series Title: Environmental Science and Engineering
Conference Title: 4th International ICSC Symposium on Information Technologies in Environmental Engineering
Conference Sponsor: ICSC
Abstract: The paper presents the results of a feasibility study in need to determine if viable, effective and reliable web based early warning service in the domain of drinking water utilities can be developed. The early warning service is intended to be used by many actors in the Republic of Ireland including water utilities managers, the Irish Environmental Protection Agency personnel and the Irish Health and Safety Executive personnel. The results of this feasibility study include an assessment of whether or not a statement of requirements for a novel early warning service can be realised using a set of existing technologies. Based on these results it is concluded that it is feasible to develop a reliable and effective web-based early warning service for drinking water utilities by adapting technologies derived from multiple disciplines including safety engineering, artificial intelligence, software and web engineering.

Authors: Ghiani, G; Manni, E; Quaranta, A; Triki, C
Author Full Names: Ghiani, Gianpaolo; Manni, Emanuele; Quaranta, Antonella; Triki, Chefi
Article Title: Anticipatory algorithms for same-day courier dispatching
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Real-time vehicle routing and dispatching; Courier industry; Waiting strategies; Idle vehicle relocation
Keywords Plus: VEHICLE-ROUTING PROBLEM; WAITING STRATEGIES; DELIVERY PROBLEM; DYNAMIC PICKUP; HEURISTICS; POLICY
Abstract: This paper describes anticipatory algorithms for the dynamic vehicle dispatching problem with pickups and deliveries, a problem faced by local area courier companies. These algorithms evaluate alternative solutions through a short-term demand sampling and a fully sequential procedure for indifference zone selection. They also exploit an unified and integrated approach in order to address all the issues involved in real-time fleet management. namely assigning requests to vehicles, routing the vehicles, scheduling the routes and relocating idle vehicles. Computational results show that the anticipatory algorithms provide consistently better solutions than their reactive counterparts. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Jing, Z. Q.; Ge, J.; Xue, H. Q.; Wang, Z.
Article Title: Comprehensive Utilization of Rainwater and Domestic Sewage in Ecological Residential Quarters
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Rainwater; Sewage; Ecological residential quarters; Comprehensive utilization
Abstract: In new built ecological residential quarters, the overall green ratio usually exceeds 30%. The scale of public facilities and road area are larger than those in ordinary residential quarters. So water consumption for greening, roads, waterscape and other facilities is enormous, which causes much burden to residents and real estate companies. Tap water is commonly the sole water resource for these usages. However, the growing price of tap water overloads this burden. New water resources must be found. Rainwater and domestic sewage may be two alternatives. They are compared in aspects of technology complexity, investment, operation cost and reliability. Rainwater can be easily treated. Unit operation cost for rainwater treatment is about 1/4 of tap water. But initial investment on rainwater collection system and reservoir is large because the scale of rainwater reuse is decided by unpotable water demand on the most unfavorable condition. The treatment facilities for domestic sewage reclamation are more complicated, but sewage capacity and quality is relatively more stable. Sewage reuse can save 1/2 of daily costs compared with tap water usage. Therefore in periods with plenty of rainfall, rainwater is the first substitute for tap water in ecological residential quarters. Rainwater collection system and reservior should be designed and installed appropriately. Sewage is a reliable water resource except tap water in periods with insufficient rainfall. But it should be treated thoroughly. When the reclaimed water is used as waterscape supplement, the sewage needs deep treatment to remove nitrogen and phosphorus effectively in case of algae propagation. Comprehensive utilization of rainwater and sewage is suggested. It can not only save investment and costs, but also enhance water supply reliability and residential environment level. The implementation of this integrated water reuse needs the support of policies and strategies.

Author Keywords: Mezzanine Financing; Real Estate; Debt; Equity
Abstract: Real estate industry, which is typically capital-intensive, has been influenced by the tightening monetary policy of the government in recent years. In a result, financing become more difficult; in such circumstances, the existing financing model should be fully developed, and innovation of real estate financing channels should be expanded. Mezzanine Financing as a novel and feasible means of financing in China is becoming a cause for concern. This paper analysis the connotation and characteristics of Mezzanine Financing then discuss some practical problems of Mezzanine Financing in real estate investment and finally draw some conclusions.

Article Title: Research on the Comparison with the Domestic Housing Industrialization and the Design of the Policy Support Framework
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Housing industrialization; Development present situation; Policy frame; Technical; Economic; Structure and organization; Layout
Abstract: As a kind of production organization way, Housing industrialization is oriented by the housing market demand, supported by science and technology progress, based on the fashioned residential building system and matching residential component, and approached by scientific organization and modernized management, which realizes integration of the housing production, supply, sales and service through joining the residential production overall process with development, design, construction, and parts production, management and service into the whole industrial system. The Housing industrialization is the inevitable choice for our housing industry in the new period, and its development in China exists many gaps compared with the advanced countries. In order to accelerate the housing industry modernization and promote its upgrading, the domestic housing industrialization development situation is compared in this paper. And a system policy framework about technology, economic, structure, organization and layout is designed from an angle of introduction and regulation. Thus the consultation for improving the policy of our housing industrialization has been provided.

Book Editors: Athanasiadis, IN; Mitkas, PA; Rizzoli, AE; Gomez, JM
Article Title: State of the art and future research in Environmental Management Information Systems - a systematic literature review
Book Series Title: Environmental Science and Engineering
Conference Title: 4th International ICSC Symposium on Information Technologies in Environmental Engineering
Conference Sponsor: ICSC
Author Keywords: Systematic Literature Review; State of the Art; Research Agenda; Environmental Management; Environmental Management Information Systems; Sustainability Reporting; Ecology
Abstract: In this paper, we present a systematic literature review in the field of Environmental Management Information Systems (EMIS). The source material of the review consists of 105 reviewed articles dating back to the time period between 2000 and 2008. Apart from an analysis of related work, this review provides an overview of applied research methods and topics in the field of EMIS as well as a categorization of the analyzed source material. The results of the review show that design science (prototyping) and argumentative-deductive analysis are the most applied research methods and that the simulation method has not been used at all so far. Furthermore, elements of a research agenda are discussed in order to determine possible further research steps in the discipline of EMIS. Like most other systematic literature reviews, this paper mainly aims at an audience of experienced researchers in the field of EMIS who are looking for research ideas and at junior scientists (e.g. PhD students) entering this emerging field of research. Practitioners might benefit from our review by gaining a stronger awareness of the importance of EMIS for business companies.

Article Title: Multilevel Coordination Emergency Management Procedure Based on Network Planning
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: network planning; activity; multi-level coordination; emergency management procedure
Abstract: Applying project management network planning ideas, according to the principle of work structure decomposition, the work of emergency management is decomposed into the minimum unit of Activity to establish the Activity database. In case of emergency events, through multiple Activity combinations, an emergency management procedure will be formed to form the emergency management organizational system. If the local emergency response capacity fails to control the deterioration of the situation, multi-level coordination emergency management procedure shall be constructed to realize fast and efficient control of unexpected events.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: A Note on Alternative Concession Model for Build Operate Transfer Projects
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Infrastructure projects; BOT; Concession period; Negotiations
Abstract: Concession period is a key decision variable in arranging a built-operate-transfer (ROT) type contract. Recently, an innovative BOT concession model (BOTCcM) was developed to quantitatively determine the value of the concession period. The model could propose an interval for possible negotiation between the host government and the private investor. Nevertheless, a major limitation in applying this model is identified in this paper. In a BOT project, the net asset value of the facility at its transfer time is significantly greater than zero. However, this net asset value was not considered in the analysis of the model. This study extends the BOTCcM to an alternative BOT concession period negotiation interval model by incorporating the net asset value of the facility at its transfer time. The span of the concession period interval proposed by the new model for negotiation between the host government and the private investor should be significantly shorter than that proposed by the BOTCcM.

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Research on the Evaluation Index System for Property Management Service Based on Analytical Hierarchy Process
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Analytical Hierarchy Process; Property Management; Evaluation Index System
Abstract: Property management, a new industry, emerging with the development of real estate market and urbanization, is deemed as a comprehensive mode of business operation established in conformance with market mechanism. With the acceleration of urbanization and the rapid development of China's real estate market, Property management service has become a factor which has a strong influence on the life quality of urban residents. It is necessary for the urban residents, property-management staff and concerned experts to consider from a strategic perspective how to establish a scientific and feasible evaluation index system for property management service. According to the theory of Analytical Hierarchy Process, this paper established an evaluation index system for property management service. By applying Analytical Hierarchy Process, this paper sets up an objective evaluation index system to make the qualitative problems quantified. This index system not only provides a scetific evaluation and management for property management, but also performs a good function in directing the property management. The index system can provide theoretical reference for the further improvement of the quality of property management service.

Article Title: Innovate the Mechanism of Rural Administrations and Promote the New Countryside Construction
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2009 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON PUBLIC ECONOMICS AND MANAGEMENT ICPEM 2009, VOL 9: SOCIAL SCIENCE METHODOLOGY
Conference Title: International Conference on Public Economics and Management (ICPEM2009)
Conference Sponsor: Xiamen Univ, Sch Econ,Econ Res Journal, Editorial Dept,World Acad Union,Minist Finance, Res Inst Fiscal Sci,Chinese Acad Social Sci, Inst Finance & Trade Econ,San Francisco State Univ, Coll Behav & Social Sci
Author Keywords: new countryside; construction; administration; mechanism; innovation
Abstract: The rural administration is the basic management work for new rural construction It has a direct impact on construction quality and efficiency Through analysis of the problems involved in the township administration, this paper comes up with the coordination mechanism of perfecting the township party-government relationships, establishment of the bottom-up decision-making mechanism, town-village linkage mechanism, market docking mechanism and long-term comprehensive training mechanism with a view to help the township to improve the quality of administration

Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Article Title: Analysis of Game Theory in bring about a Pleasant Environment of Property Enterprise
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: Game theory; Nash Equilibrium (NE); Pleasant environment; Supporting services and facilities
Abstract: With the planned economic system turning into the market economy system, Chinese housing construction is transiting the supply system to the market system. Now the housing system reform has been well accepted by the public. Expect affordable house and low-rent house that government afford to the low-income families and No-housing families, It has been turned toward the housing market of housing construction. There is increasing amount of attention and focus directed at studying the important role of harmonious housing in building a society. Particularly it is the important of Property Enterprise in the development of Residential Area, a pleasant environment and perfect supporting services and facilities. This article seeks to explore through application of the Complete Information Static Game Theory, the interaction between the property developers and buyers, how the relationship can attain the Nash Equilibrium (NE), with focus on the behaviors and rationality of both parties, culminating in the creation harmonious housing.

Authors: Zillante, G; Arman, M; Davidson, K; Wilson, L; Pullen, S; Zuo, JA
Book Editors: Li, QM; Yang, J; Yam, MCH; Deng, XP
Author Full Names: Zillante, George; Arman, Michael; Davidson, Kathryn; Wilson, Lou; Pullen, Stephen; Zuo, Jian
Article Title: The sustainable and affordable housing debate in Australia
Source Title: CRIOCM2009: INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ADVANCEMENT OF CONSTRUCTION MANAGEMENT AND REAL ESTATE, VOLS 1-6
Conference Title: International Symposium on Advancement of Construction Management and Real Estate
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Res Inst Construct Management,SE Univ, Sch Civil Engn,China Real Estate Assoc,Architectural Soc China, Construct Econ Sub Soc
Author Keywords: social sustainability; affordable housing; policy; Australia
Abstract: Improving the sustainability and affordability of housing tend to be parallel objectives among Australian policy makers. Whereas traditionally the objectives of housing affordability and housing sustainability were considered in isolation, policy responses are increasingly recognising the importance of both. However, any policy attempting to foster best practise in terms of affordability and sustainable housing must be able to link housing outcomes with the broader community; that is, affordable and sustainable housing must be socially sustainable. This paper considers social sustainability in terms of social acceptability, the minimisation of social exclusion and the fostering of social capital. Affordability is also analysed at a conceptual level before the concluding discussion attempts to overlay the two concepts in suggesting how social sustainability may be fostered in affordable and sustainable housing.

Article Title: The tax treatment of company cars, commuting and optimal congestion taxes
Author Keywords: Congestion; Optimal taxation; Fringe benefits; Company cars
Abstract: In Europe, the preferential tax treatment of company cars implies that many employees receive a company car as part of their compensation package. In this paper, we consider a model in which wages and the decision whether or not to provide a company car are the result of direct negotiation between employer and employee. Using this framework, we theoretically and numerically study first- and second-best optimal tax policies on labour and transport markets, focusing on the role of the tax treatment of company cars. We obtain the following results. First, higher labour taxes and a more favourable tax treatment of company cars raise the fraction employees that receives a company car; congestion and congestion tolls reduce it. Second, in countries that provide large implicit subsidies to company cars, eliminating the preferential tax treatment of company cars may be an imperfect but quite effective substitute for currently unavailable congestion tolls. The numerical illustration, calibrated using Belgian data, suggests that it yields about half the welfare gain attainable through optimal congestion taxes. Third, the favourable tax treatment of company cars justifies large public transport subsidies; the numerical results are consistent with zero public transport fares. Finally, we find that earlier models that ignored the preferential tax treatment of company cars may have substantially underestimated optimal congestion tolls in Europe. The numerical illustration suggests that about one third of the optimal congestion toll we obtain can be attributed to the current tax treatment of company cars. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: A novel interval-valued fuzzy MCDM method for improving airlines' service quality in Chinese cross-strait airlines
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: MCDM; VIKOR; GRA; Service quality; Interval-valued fuzzy sets
Keywords Plus: GROUP DECISION-MAKING; PERFORMANCE EVALUATION; MULTICRITERIA ANALYSIS; VIKOR; MODEL; TOPSIS; EXTENSIONS; OPERATIONS; IDEAL
Abstract: This paper presents an effective approach based on combining VIKOR, GRA, and interval-valued fuzzy sets to evaluate service quality of Chinese cross-strait passenger airlines via customer surveys. The proposed approach can enable decision-makers to understand the gaps between alternatives and aspired levels. An empirical study is used to establish a complete service quality evaluation framework for reducing the gaps to achieve the aspired level. Based on the gaps in priorities, it can help an airline to identify its own strengths and weaknesses in specific areas of passenger service to further improve service quality. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Article Title: Hysteresis in traffic flow revisited: An improved measurement method
Author Keywords: Hysteresis; Traffic flow; Kinematic wave theory
Abstract: This paper presents new insights on the hysteresis phenomenon in congested freeway traffic. It is found that existing theories based on different driver behavior for acceleration and deceleration are incomplete. The data suggests that one needs to consider aggressive and timid driver behavior as well. These findings are based on an improved method for measuring traffic flow variables from trajectory data consistently with kinematic wave theory. (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Min, YH; Park, MJ; Hong, SP; Hong, SH
Author Full Names: Min, Yun-Hong; Park, Myoung-Ju; Hong, Sung-Pi; Hong, Soon-Heum
Article Title: An appraisal of a column-generation-based algorithm for centralized train-conflict resolution on a metropolitan railway network
Author Keywords: Train-conflict resolution; NP-hardness; Column generation; Fix-and-regenerate
Keywords Plus: TRAFFIC OPTIMIZATION; TIMETABLING PROBLEM; SCHEDULING PROBLEM; FREIGHT RAILROADS; MODEL; TIME; MANAGEMENT; TRACK; HEURISTICS; COMPLEXITY
Abstract: In practice, a train-conflict resolution is decentralized around dispatchers each of whom controls a few segments in a global railway network with her rule-of-thumb to operational data. Conceptually, the global sub-optimality or infeasibility of the decentralized system is resolved by a network controller who coordinates the dispatchers and train operators at the lower layers on a real-time basis. However, such notion of a multi-layer system cannot be effectual unless the top layer is able to provide a global solution soon enough for the dynamic lower layers to adapt in a seamless manner. Unfortunately, a train-conflict resolution problem is NP-hard as formally established in this paper and an effective solution method traded off between computation time and solution quality has been lacking in literature. Thus, we propose a column-generation-based algorithm that exploits the separability of the problem. A key ingredient of the algorithm is an efficient heuristic for the pricing subproblem for column generation. Tested on the real data from the Seoul metropolitan railway network, the algorithm provides near-optimal conflict-free timetables in a few seconds for most cases. The performance of the proposed algorithm is compared to the ones of the previous MIP-based heuristic by Tornquist and Persson (2007) and the priority-based heuristic by Sahin (1999). (C) 2010 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Gulczynski, D; Golden, B; Wasil, E
Author Full Names: Gulczynski, Damon; Golden, Bruce; Wasil, Edward
Article Title: The split delivery vehicle routing problem with minimum delivery amounts
Source Title: TRANSPORTATION RESEARCH PART E-LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION REVIEW
Author Keywords: Vehicle routing problem; Heuristics; Mixed integer program
Abstract: In the vehicle routing problem, a fleet of vehicles must service the demands of customers in a least-cost way. By allowing multiple vehicles to service the same customer (i.e., splitting deliveries), substantial savings in travel costs are possible. However, split deliveries are often an inconvenience to the customer who would prefer to have demand serviced in a single visit. We consider the vehicle routing problem in which split deliveries are allowed only if a minimum fraction of a customer's demand is serviced by a vehicle. We develop a heuristic method for solving this problem and report computational results on a wide range of problem sets. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

Authors: Verhoef, ET; Koh, A; Shepherd, S
Author Full Names: Verhoef, Erik T.; Koh, Andrew; Shepherd, Simon
Article Title: Pricing, capacity and long-run cost functions for first-best and second-best network problems
Author Keywords: Traffic congestion; Road pricing; Road capacity choice; Second-best; Networks
Keywords Plus: TRANSPORTATION NETWORKS; CONGESTION; TOLLS; ROADS; PEAK; COMPETITION; DEMAND; MODEL
Abstract: This paper considers the use of 'long-run cost functions' for congested networks in solving second-best network problems, in which capacity and tolls are instruments. We derive analytical results both for general cost and demand functions and for specific functional forms, namely Bureau of Public Roads cost functions and constant-elasticity demand functions. The latter are also used in a numerical simulation model. We consider second-best cases where only a sub-set of links in a network is subject to tolling and/or capacity choice, and cases with and without a self-financing constraint imposed. We will demonstrate that, under certain assumptions, second-best long-run cost (or actually: generalized price) functions can be derived for most of the cases of interest, which can be used in an applied network model as a substitute for the conventional short-run user cost functions. Doing so reduces the dimensionality of the problem and should therefore be helpful in speeding up procedures for finding second-best optima. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.
